page.title: SW mod main page
page.t: The Z-95 Headhunter was a starfighter designed jointly by the Incom and SubPro Corporations years before the Invasion of Naboo. Its resilience and longevity meant it remained a staple of private and low-priority government starfighter forces long after its introduction.

The RZ-1 A-wing interceptor, also known as the RZ-1 A-wing starfighter, was a wedge-shaped starfighter manufactured by Kuat Systems Engineering, which took design inspiration from the Republic starfighters of the Clone Wars. Based on the original R-22 prototype, the early Rebel movement adopted the fighter for service against the Galactic Empire
The BTL-A4 Y-wing starfighter, also referred to simply as the Y-wing fighter or Y-wing, was a series of multi-role starfighter-bombers manufactured by Koensayr Manufacturing.

The BTL Y-wing starfighter, also referred to simply as the Y-wing fighter or Y-wing, was a series of multi-role starfighter-bombers manufactured by Koensayr Manufacturing. This is a scout variant with additional sensors in place of missile storage and launchers.

The A/SF-01 B-wing starfighter, also designated as the A/SF-01 B-wing assault starfighter, more commonly referred to as the B-wing, was a heavily armed Rebel Alliance single-pilot starfighter and bomber manufactured by Slayn and Korpil. Featuring a radical design where the ship rotated around the cockpit, the B-wing was a challenge to master even for experienced pilots, but its impressive weaponry allowed for devastating attacks on capital ships and ground targets.

The E-7 E-wing multi-role starfighter, also called the E-wing escort starfighter, was a single-pilot starfighter developed by FreiTek Inc. It was notable for being the first fighter designed entirely under the support of the New Republic. Despite many issues in development, it has become a staple of the New Republic Defence Fleet. Though some models did not mount missile launchers, this production model features two.

The T-65 X-wing is one of the most iconic starfighters in the galaxy. Descended from such fighters as the Z-95 Headhunter and the ARC-170 starfighter, the designers at Incom intended to build a well-rounded snubfighter with no exploitable weaknesses. 

Originally intended for use by the Imperial Navy, Incom sold the design to the Alliance to Restore the Republic after the Galactic Empire instead chose Sienar's TIE series as their mainline fighter.

The T-65B X-wing starfighter was a modified version of the standard X-wing starfighter produced by Incom Corporation. They were faster, more updated fighters compared to their predecessors.

The Firespray-31-class patrol and attack craft, also known simply as a Firespray-class interceptor, is a patrol ship originally designed by Kuat Systems Engineering. Originally intended for use by the Republic Correctional Authority, Firesprays found their way into the hands of many law enforcement agencies, private interests, pirates, and bounty hunters. Its distinctive design lands horizontally on its engines, but rotates to a vertical configuration in flight.\n\nThe most famous of these ships was Slave 1, owned by the bounty hunters Jango and Boba Fett.

The TIE/LN starfighter, or TIE/line starfighter, simply known as the TIE Fighter or T/F, is the standard Imperial starfighter seen in massive numbers throughout most of the Galactic Civil War and onward. Colloquially, Rebel pilots referred to the craft as "eyeballs.". This is a modification outfitted with an auxiliary shield generator.
TIE Fighter Vanguard or TIE/LNv is the modification outfitted with regular shield generator slot and hyperdrive used by escorts for high ranking officers.
Mining Guild TIE Fighter or TIE/mg is the modification of TIE Fighter with removed frontal panels for improved visibility in asteroid fields.

The TIE/IN starfighter, simply known as the TIE Interceptor or T/I, was a TIE Series starfighter used by the Galactic Empire. The TIE Interceptor was identifiable by its arrow-shaped solar collection panels, a distinct difference from the hexagonal solar arrays of its predecessor, the TIE Fighter. The Interceptor was one of the fastest starfighters in the galaxy at its prime, nearly rivalling the Alliance's RZ-1 A-wing interceptor. Due to their speed, distinct shape, and narrow profile in comparison to the TIE/ln starfighter (which was nicknamed "eyeball"), TIE Interceptors came to be referred to occasionally as "squints" by enemy pilots. This is a late modification outfitted with a shield generator.

Part of a line of experimental models based on the TIE series, Sienar Fleet Systems' TIE/x1, most commonly referred to as the TIE Advanced, came standard with both a hyperdrive and shield deflectors. While the Advanced model was never put into full-scale production, many Imperial ace pilots were known to choose it as their fighter of choice. One well known-- and greatly feared-- pilot was Darth Vader himself, who personally customised his TIE-x1 to suit his flying skills.

The TIE/D Defender, commonly known as the TIE Defender or T/D, was a high-performance TIE Series starfighter developed for the Imperial Navy by Sienar Fleet Systems in a project overseen by Grand Admiral Demetrius Zaarin shortly before the Battle of Endor. Representing a shift in starfighter design from previous TIE models, the ship featured a hyperdrive as well as deflector shields to allow it to operate independently of Imperial capital ships. The ship's speed and agility, combined with its arsenal of four laser cannons, two ion cannons and two warhead launchers made it arguably the most advanced starfighter available at the time.

The UT-60D U-wing starfighter/support craft, also known as the UT-60D, U-wing or UT-60D U-wing Troop Transport, is a transport/gunship model manufactured by Incom Corporation. It was used primarily by the Rebel Alliance to drop soldiers into battle and provide cover for them, using both its forward guns and optionally-mounted infantry weapons at the loading doors.

The TIE/sa bomber, simply known as the TIE bomber or T/B, was a larger, less manoeuvrable TIE starfighter used for destroying large starships and pinpoint-precision bombing. The "sa" in the TIE bomber's designation stood for "surface assault."

The TIE/sh shuttle, also known as the TIE Command Shuttle, was a model of armoured shuttle manufactured by Sienar Fleet Systems for the Galactic Empire. It was designed to transport Imperial officers plus a squad of stormtroopers between Imperial-class Star Destroyers.

The Sheathipede-class transport shuttle, also known as the Sheathipede-class shuttles and as the Neimoidian escort shuttle, was a short-range transport used by the Trade Federation and the Confederacy of Independent Systems. Some of these shuttles had their cockpits removed and replaced with automated pilots, and others were heavily modified with additional shielding or weaponry.

The quadrijet transfer spacetug was a model of spacetug manufactured by Subpro Corporation for use in orbital transfer yards. The vessels used magnetic clamps to attach themselves to the undersides of cargo containers and then quickly move them around within the yards using their four large thrusters.

The Belbullab-22 starfighter was a single-pilot heavy starfighter model employed by the Confederacy of Independent Systems during the Clone Wars. Since the end of that conflict, the fighter has been updated and modernised to continue production. General Grievous flew a customised Belbullab-22 named the Soulless One.

The Belbullab-22 starfighter was a single-pilot heavy starfighter model employed by the Confederacy of Independent Systems during the Clone Wars. Since the end of that conflict, the fighter has been updated and modernised to continue production. This is a lightweight scout version.

The G1-M4-C Dunelizard, also known as the Medium Hutt Fighter, was a starfighter of medium weight developed by the Hutts and produced by MandalMotors. It saw use during the Galactic Civil War among various pirate groups, as well as mercenaries, privateers, and even some planetary defence forces.

The Variable Geometry Self-Propelled Battle Droid, Mark I, also known as the Vulture-class droid, is a droid starfighter originally used by the Trade Federation. Later, in much greater numbers, it was utilised by the Confederacy of Independent Systems.

Probe droids (also known as probots or recon droids) were droids that were specifically designed and programmed to perform reconnaissance duties. These units were often dispatched by various space navies to gather information from a variety of different locations, reporting anything of significance as defined by specific preprogrammed protocols.

The M12-L Kimogila heavy fighter was designed as part of the collaboration between MandalMotors and the Hutt Cartel. Officially an upgrade to the G1-M4-C Dunelizard, the Kimogila is heavily armed and armoured, and serves as a long-range, multipurpose ship. Though originally intended for use by the Hutts, it also saw use by pirates, mercenaries, and some planetary defence forces.

The Scurrg H-6 was created five years before the Battle of Naboo by the Nubian Design Collective, who hoped to sell the design to the Naboo. However, the Naboo had no need for such a bomber, and the original prototype was stolen by the Feeorin pirate Nym, who later named it Havoc.

Hyena-class bombers, also known as Hyena-class Droid Bombers, were droid starfighters manufactured by Baktoid Armour Workshop. They were designed for heavy ordnance bombing runs. Based on Vulture droid designs, Hyena bombers had wider and sturdier hulls with huge wings to gain stability during flight.

The HWK-290 was a light freighter manufactured by the Corellian Engineering Corporation during the decades leading up to the Battle of Naboo, in an effort to break into a new market for fast, small cargo ships. Unlike YT-series of ships for tramp captains, the Hawk line was aimed at more upscale clients, like wealthy merchants and noble politicians. The series saw modest success, but never reached the amount of sales of YT-series, and was discontinued during the Clone Wars to make way for military production.
The Fortitude-class assault shuttle was a shuttle utilised by the Galactic Republic during the Cold War and Galactic War with the Sith Empire.

The BTA-NR2 Y-wing starfighter is a variant of the Y-wing starfighter produced by Koensayr Manufacturing and used by the New Republic. It was designed to emulate the appearance and customisable nature of the BTL-A4 Y-wing flown extensively by the Rebel Alliance, though it sacrifices some durability for speed, agility, and a larger ordnance bay.
The Emperor's Royal Guard TIE/IN starfighter was a specially modified version of the TIE/IN interceptor. These TIE Interceptors were flown only by Emperor Palpatine's Royal Guard.

The Eta-2 Actis-class interceptor was a Republic starfighter used late in the Clone Wars, that shared design elements with the Republic's Delta-7 and Delta-7B starfighters, as well as the TIE fighters of the later Galactic Empire. This model is a modernised version that is also equipped with a hyperdrive. While these modifications improve the vessels' overall versatility, they also make it a bit slower.

The Delta-7B Aethersprite-class interceptor was commissioned just before the outbreak of the Clone Wars. The starfighter was considered highly advanced at the time of its creation and carried sophisticated equipment, but it was expensive to produce. The 7B version is modified with additional shields and weaponry compared to baseline Delta-7 models used by the Jedi.

The Starchaser is a solid starfighter capable of competing with the Z-95 Headhunter. It had a good balance of speed, weapons and durability, but lacks heavy armour or internal hull bracing, which often makes it vulnerable to well-placed enemy hits.

The Theta-class T-2c shuttle, also known as the Theta-class shuttle, was a model of shuttle used by the Galactic Republic, and later the Galactic Empire. It was designed as part of the Abecederian line of shuttles manufactured by Cygnus Spaceworks and later Sienar Fleet Systems, and saw use by Chancellor, and later Emperor, Palpatine.

The Aggressive ReConnaissance-170 starfighter, also known simply as the ARC-170 starfighter, is a heavy-duty model of starfighter used by the Galactic Republic during the Clone Wars and was considered the latest in fighter technology. Jointly manufactured by Incom Corporation and Subpro, it was eventually modified to compete with modern fighters. Its tail gunner turret was replaced by a slaved ion cannon, similar to the Y-wing.

The droid tri-fighter is a model of droid starfighter that was specifically designed to engage and excel in heavy dogfighting. Its brain is housed in the central gyroscopic core, and its arms carry laser cannons and missile launchers. It was used extensively by the Confederacy of Independent Systems during the Clone Wars, where it rivalled the Republic's starfighters.

The TIE/es assault shuttle, or TIE Echelon, is a transport developed for certain Imperial remnant groups that is often used as a boarding craft, due to its ability to disable enemy ships with its 4 ion cannons.

The Kihraxz is a starfighter developed by TransGalMeg Industries. Though vaguely modelled after the popular design of Incom's X-wing starfighter, few Kihraxz fighters were the same due to heavy customisation and after-market kits. Though originally intended for use by the Black Sun crime syndicate, this fighter ended up in the hands of various pirates, mercenaries, and other spacers during the Galactic Civil War.
The TIE Brute is a variant of the TIE line starfighters, distinguished by its extra pod housing more powerful laser cannons. It is also more armoured compared to smaller TIE variants.

The TIE Phantom is the result of a development project led by Grand Admiral Martio Batch and is equipped with both deflector shields and a hyperdrive, along with a technology not seen for decades â€” a cloaking device. Models and schematics sold to third-party vendors conspicuously leave the cloak missing, however, though the mount for the device remains-- intrepid spacers may be able to replace it for less-than-legal activity.

Initially the TIE Fury competed with TIE Defender as another actively developed project. While TIE Defender was selected for future development and implementation in fleet doctrine, the TIE Fury was reworked into an /H heavy variant with increased missile capacity and additional ion cannons compared to TIE Defender. It is usually used by elite forces to quickly suppress larger vessels. Due to limited supply this ship is not freely available on the market.

The T-65XJ-3/5 X-wing starfighter is a successor to T-65B model, tangential to the T-70 development. Though it sacrifices some manoeuvrability compared to its predecessor, it is faster, more durable, and has a larger ordnance bay.

The Porax-38 starfighter is a tough, heavy starfighter used by the Utapauan government during the Clone Wars. It has since been updated and can be found in some militia forces. The cockpit was updated on this model to accommodate many different species.

The Porax-38-B starfighter is a modified heavy fighter used by the Utapauan government during Clone Wars. This is an upgraded model that is commonly used by Outer Rim pirates and Mandalorians, that sacrifices speed and manoeuvrability for additional armour and weaponry.
The BTL-B Y-wing is a modernised starfighter-bomber used by the Republic during the Clone Wars.
The BTL-BP Y-wing starfighter is a stripped down version of the original BTL-B Y-wing, usually used by militias and criminals as it is easier to maintain.
The BTL-BPM Y-wing starfighter is a stripped down version of the original BTL-B Y-wing, additionally modified by Mandalorians.

The Fang-class starfighter, also known as the Fang fighter, is a starfighter manufactured by SoroSuub Corporation and MandalMotors and used by the Mandalorians. The Fang fighter is a fast and highly manoeuvrable starship designed specifically for space combat.

The N-1 starfighter, also called the Naboo starfighter, is a single-seat patrol craft developed by Theed Palace Space Vessel Engineering Corps and used by the Royal Naboo Security Forces for duties such as defence, patrol, and escorting.
This version of the N-1 Starfighter was modified by an unknown bounty hunter with high-thrust engines, but it lacks an astromech port.
Little is known about capabilities of this Sith starfighter.
This is the Yuuzhan Vong version of a starfighter. It features no metal parts, and carries unconventional propulsion, shields, and weaponry.

The TIE Striker is a streamlined variant of the TIE line starfighters. Due to its horizontal high-speed wings and large central pod it is faster than most other TIEs, but it lacks the same manoeuvrability.
The Scimitar assault bomber is an advanced starfighter/bomber based on TIE Series technology.
The Victor-wing starfighter is used by different mercenary and militia groups across the universe, featuring a heavier than usual turret for a starfighter that makes it a powerful foe.

The Scarab-class Starfighter was developed for the Trade Federation prior to its invasion of Naboo, but was quickly supplanted by the Vulture-class droid starfighter. Compared to its successor, the Scarab is more heavily armed and armoured, but is not as agile. It also features a cockpit compartment and hyperdrive, allowing for independent use by organic pilots.

The Low Altitude Assault Transport/carrier, known more simply as the LAAT/c, is a vehicle carrier variant of Rothana Heavy Engineering's Low Altitude Assault Transport series of repulsorlift gunships developed for the Grand Army of the Republic. The LAAT/c was originally designed to deploy All Terrain Tactical Enforcers onto battlefields, though it was quickly modified to carry cargo pods.

The Low Altitude Assault Transport/infantry, known more simply as the LAAT/i, is one of several models in the Low Altitude Assault Transport line of starships that mainly served as gunships and troop transports for the Grand Army of the Republic during the Clone Wars. It has since been modified to make it lighter, less reliant on the trained crew, and more focused on its gunship capabilities.

The T-70 X-wing starfighter is the successor to the T-65B X-wing starfighter and cousin to the XJ-3/5 project, manufactured by Incom-FreiTek Corporation for use by the New Republic Defence Fleet. It is currently in the testing phase and is envisioned as a lighter, faster, more manoeuvrable version of T65B, in contrast to the heavier XJ3 project.

The Alpha-3 Nimbus-class V-wing is a medium starfighter model, designed by Kuat Systems Engineering, that saw use late in the Clone Wars and early in the reign of the Galactic Empire. Since its retirement by the Imperial Navy in favour of the TIE fighter series, the blueprint was sold to CSA-affiliated companies that have modernised the fighter. Part of the modernisation of the V-wing included replacing the original twin ion engines with 2a Fission Engines produced by Incom Drive Systems, as well as a hyperdrive.

The V-19 Torrent starfighter is a model of starfighter manufactured by Slayn and Korpil. They were used by the Republic Navy during the Clone Wars and later modified and sold to CSA, but it is still considered an outdated frame. Though early models utilised a hyperdrive ring, later models came with their own hyperdrive system.

The Miy'til starfighter is a fighter unique to the Hapes Consortium, where it serves as the primary superiority fighter for the Hapan Royal Navy. Like other small starfighters, it is lightly-armed, but its miniaturised components ensure it remains a viable starship.
An experimental TIE design of unknown origin.

The TIE Reaper is a troop carrier variant of Sienar Fleet Systems's TIE fighter series used by the Galactic Empire. Similar in design to the TIE/sk Striker, it features horizontal wings, rather than the traditional vertical wings the TIE family is known for. This allowed it to more easily land in active battlefields and deploy elite troops, such as Death Troopers at the Battle of Scarif.

The GR-75 Medium Transport, also known as the Gallofree medium transport, is a starship originally produced by Gallofree Yards, Inc. Its outer hull is a lightly armoured hollow shell, with the interior entirely open for cargo pods. While used in Rebel Alliance fleets against the Galactic Empire, its light armament and armour prohibited it from being used as a frontline warship. Instead, they typically remained in the rearguard of fleets. Due to their modular design, they were often used as supply ships, troop transports, and communications vessels.\n\nSeveral GR-75 transports famously participated in the evacuation of Rebel forces at the Battle of Hoth.

Based on Gallofree Shipyard's GR-75, the GR-75 Battle Refit exchanges cargo capacity for additional weapons, armour and shielding. While the modifications improve its combat capabilities, the Battle Refit can't compete against dedicated combat vessels. This variant saw more use as a support ship in small convoys, or as a security vessel for private corporations and planetary governments.

The YT-1300 is a light freighter manufactured by the Corellian Engineering Corporation, as part of their YT-series of ships. It was incredibly popular among spacers due to its reliability and ease of modification, and remained in common use throughout the galaxy long after it became outdated. \n\nAfter the stellar performance of General Han Solo's modified YT-1300, the Millennium Falcon, during the Battle of Endor, Alliance command commissioned the CEC to restart production of the YT-1300 series freighter with similar modifications.

The YT-1300 is a light freighter manufactured by the Corellian Engineering Corporation, as part of their YT-series of ships. It was incredibly popular among spacers due to its reliability and ease of modification, and remained in common use throughout the galaxy long after it became outdated. \n\nThis model comes equipped with an escape pod mounted in the forward mandibles.

The G9 Rigger-class light freighter, or simply the G9 Rigger freighter was a model of freighter manufactured by the Corellian Engineering Corporation and used during the Clone Wars. Its only weapons were small blaster cannons attached to the wings and top of the freighter. Jedi General Anakin Skywalker acquired a G9 Rigger, the Twilight, during the Battle of Teth and kept it as a personal project throughout the war, periodically modifying it and making repairs, until its eventual destruction at the hands of the Shadow Collective.

The CR90 Corvette, also known as the Corellian Corvette or blockade runner, is a small, multipurpose starship manufactured by the Corellian Engineering Corporation. It is a versatile ship with a modular design, often seeing use in roles such as freight-hauling, diplomatic transportation, and as a light capital ship in various navies. Many served within the fleets of the Alliance to Restore the Republic, and now serve as a mainline corvette within the New Republic.\n\nOne of the more famous examples of this class, the Tantive IV, carried Princess Leia Organa as she fled the Empire with the plans for the Death Star.

The CR90 Corvette, also known as the Corellian Corvette or blockade runner, is a small, multipurpose starship manufactured by the Corellian Engineering Corporation. It is a versatile ship with a modular design, often seeing use in roles such as freight-hauling, diplomatic transportation, and as a light capital ship in various navies. Many served within the fleets of the Alliance to Restore the Republic, and now serve as a mainline corvette within the New Republic.\n\nThis version is modified with heavier armour plating.

The CR90 Corvette, also known as the Corellian Corvette or blockade runner, is a small, multipurpose starship manufactured by the Corellian Engineering Corporation. It is a versatile ship with a modular design, often seeing use in roles such as freight-hauling, diplomatic transportation, and as a light capital ship in various navies. Many served within the fleets of the Alliance to Restore the Republic, and now serve as a mainline corvette within the New Republic.\n\nThis version is modified with forward-facing guns.
The Action IV transport is an old Corellian Engineering Corporation medium bulk freighter of the Action series.
The Action IV transport is an old Corellian Engineering Corporation medium bulk freighter of the Action series. This is a mining operations refit.
The Action IV transport is an old Corellian Engineering Corporation medium bulk freighter of the Action series. This is a gas collection operations refit.
This is a combat refit of Action IV transport. Cargo space was replaced with better reactors, and a prow turbolaser and missile launchers were installed to give it needed firepower.
The Gozanti Armed cruiser is a class of heavily armoured starship used by various factions. In its use with the Galactic Empire, it was known generally as the Imperial freighter.
The Gozanti-class Cruiser is a class of heavily armoured starship. This is a modification that sacrifices cargo space for heavy forward weaponry and ability to dock 4 fighters.
The Gozanti-class cruiser is a class of heavily armoured starship used by various factions. It is a slow but powerful independent transport designed by Corellian Engineering Corporation.

The Gozanti-class cruiser is a class of heavily armoured starship used by various factions. It is a slow but powerful independent transport designed by Corellian Engineering Corporation. This is the Miner refit.

The C-ROC Gozanti-class light cruiser is a class of light cruiser that was equipped with the Configuration-Restored Operational Capacity upgrade, a shipyard custom configuration of the standard civilian Gozanti-class cruiser, which was meant to be a midlife upgrade program to reinvigorate the Gozanti-class and ensure profitability.

The C-ROC Gozanti-class light cruiser is a class of light cruiser that was equipped with the Configuration-Restored Operational Capacity upgrade. This version is a further modification popular among pirates and other scum, using extra cargo space to mount additional weapons and shield generators.

The Lambda-class T-4a shuttle, also known as the Imperial Lambda, Imperial Transport or the Imperial Shuttle, was a multi-purpose transport with a trihedral foil design used by the Galactic Empire during the Galactic Civil War, and was considered an elegant departure from the standards of brutish Imperial engineering.

The Consular-class space cruiser/corvette was a starship designed and manufactured by the Corellian Engineering Corporation and used by the Galactic Republic to transport Jedi and diplomats to troubled spots across the galaxy. Civilian models of the Consular-class cruiser were used for straight-forward transportation and were indistinct.

The Consular-class space cruiser/corvette was a starship designed and manufactured by the Corellian Engineering Corporation and used by the Galactic Republic to transport Jedi and diplomats to troubled spots across the galaxy. Civilian models of the Consular-class cruiser were used for straightforward transportation and were indistinct.

The Imperial Customs Office employed a force of patrol vessels that operated independently from the Imperial Navy in order to spare the Imperial government the expense of assigning ships of the line to monitor shipping, interdict piracy, and perform search-and-rescue operations.

The Defender-class light corvette is an ancient starship that saw use in one of the many conflicts between the Old Republic and the Sith Empire. Originally based on a similar consumer corvette, the Defender was modified for use by Jedi as a mobile operations base and capable starfighter.\n\nIn recent years the design has been restored and modernised, and sees use among a wide variety of local militias, corporate fleets, and pirates.

The CSS-1 Corellian Star Shuttle, sometimes referred to simply as the CSS-1 shuttle or as the Republic shuttle, was a transport used by the Galactic Republic for at least a decade before the start of the Clone Wars. It is still in use by some private companies after some modernisation of internal systems.
The Settie-class drop ship was a class of dropship used by the Separatist navy during the Clone Wars. It was refit to serve a transport role after the Clone Wars ended.

The Crusader-class corvette is a light warship developed by Mandal Hypernautics shortly after the end of the Clone Wars. Naming the ship after the ancient Mandalorian Crusaders, Mandal Hypernautics originally planned to sell the ship to the Galactic Empire, though the Imperial Navy rejected the ship and it was instead sold to the Mandalorian clans. Intended to engage smaller starships, its high speed and significant armament also allow it to take on corvettes of comparable size.
The Stathas-class Freighter is an armed transport ship produced by MandalMotors.
The Stathas-class Freighter is an armed transport ship produced by MandalMotors. This is the miner refit.
The Stathas-class Freighter is an armed transport ship produced by MandalMotors. This is the gas collector refit.

The ST-70-class Razor Crest M-111, commonly referred to as the ST-70 Assault Ship or just the Razor Crest, is a model of gunship. Prior to the rise of the Galactic Empire, Razor Crest gunships served as military patrol crafts and were used mainly by outer rim militias and private organisations. One such ship was owned by the Mandalorian bounty hunter Din Djarin.

The AEG-77-E Vigo is a heavily modified transport vessel used as a convoy escort and patrol gunboat. As the original transports became known for their light weaponry, increased pirate activity forced merchant convoys to modify some ships to carry heavier weapons, missile launchers, and shields. Eventually these gunboats found their way into the hands of independent spacers.

The AEG-77-T Vigo is a transport vessel that was used by Xizor Transport Systems, Black Sun and many other organisations and individuals. It was easily modified and could mount multiple light turrets. While not as heavily armed as the later escort gunship, the AEG-77-T has a larger cargo capacity.

The Sphyrna-class Hammerhead corvette is a ship that saw wide use during the Imperial Era as an armed transport. Featuring a distinctive bow design reminiscent of ancient Republic warships, the Sphyrna is bulky, well-armed, and well-armoured. After heavy modification, it currently serves as a mainline warship in the naval forces of the Alliance and New Republic.

The Raider-class corvette was a starship originally manufactured by Kuat Drive Yards. The 150 meter-long corvette was used by the Galactic Empire to support TIE fighters in engagements against the Rebel Alliance, filling a tactical void in the Imperial Navy as a counterpart to the Rebel CR90.

This craft is a standard medium-sized freighter that is common throughout the entire galaxy. It is low-cost, partly due to its lack of defensive armament, and is capable of extremely long range bulk transport duties.

The VCX-100 light freighter was one of the Corellian Engineering Corporation's freighter designs. One of the most infamous examples of a VCX-100 is the Ghost, piloted by General Hera Syndulla of the Rebel Alliance and New Republic.
The Dornean gunship is a model of gunship designed by the Dornean species and built by the Dornean Braha'ket Fleetworks Conglomerate to protect their homeworld, Dornea, from the Galactic Empire.

The Lancer Pursuit Craft is a patrol ship produced by MandalMotors. Blurring the line between civilian freighter and warship, the Lancer was more interdiction and patrol vessel than workaday cargo hauler. Created on special commission for Black Sun by MandalMotors, the Lancer was designed to chase down fleeing cargo vessels and outrun other patrol ships.

The YV-666 light freighter, also known simply as YV-series light freighter or YV-666, is an old model of light freighter that was designed by the Corellian Engineering Corporation and is currently produced by some Outer Rim companies. Quite popular among pirates and smugglers due to its versatility.
Named after a planet which was controlled by the Imperial Mining Company, this shuttle became one of the powerhouses of Empire mining operations. This is a modification for ore mining.
Named after a planet which was controlled by the Imperial Mining Company, this shuttle became one of the powerhouses of Empire mining operations. This is a modification for gas collection.
The J-type 327 Nubian starship is a starship model designed and built by Nubia Star Drives, Inc. and used by various factions and corporations for light freight trading and as VIP transport.

Produced by Starfeld Industries, the ZH-40 Tribune-class light freighter was designed with both protection and profit in mind, fielding numerous pilot-controlled weapons and a powerful dorsal turret. The robustness and defensive capabilities of the Tribune has made it a favourite of many outer-rim traders and smugglers.

The GS-80, or Gallofree Gunship, is one of the few dedicated warship designs produced by Gallofree Yards. Sporting five main guns, four torpedo launch tubes, and three defensive turrets, the GS-80 has found itself in the hands of private organisations, the Rebel Alliance, and even the New Republic Defence Fleet. At least one GS-80 was present at the Battle of Endor.

The Dynamic-class freighter was a light freighter built by a subsidiary of Core Galaxy Systems on the remote Republic world of Transel around the period of the Mandalorian Wars. A stock Dynamic-class freighter was only modestly armed and shielded; however, the ship was designed to accept modifications without compromising existing systems and most ships were therefore heavily customised by their owners. By this date these ships are no longer produced and can be rarely seen.
The Kom'rk-class fighter/transport, also known as the Gauntlet starfighter, was a type of starfighter and troop transport used by the Mandalorian splinter faction known as Death Watch.

A collaboration between Corellian and Koensayr engineers resulted in a modular transporter ship that was often modified for different roles and purposes. There was a legal dispute around ship model naming, and in the end people started to call it a C-K Transporter/Miner. This is a solid miner modification.

A collaboration between Corellian and Koensayr engineers resulted in a modular transporter ship that was often modified for different roles and purposes. There was a legal dispute around ship model naming, and in the end people started to call it a C-K Transporter/Miner. This is a gas collector modification.
The S-161 "Stinger" XL is a model of luxury yacht manufactured by Latero Spaceworks. Built for wealthy executives, the Stinger is fast and elegant.

The SoroSuub Personal Luxury Yacht 3000 is exactly what its name suggests: a yacht, suitable for carrying passengers in luxury. It has been used to carry everything from famous dignitaries to illegal cargo. The most famous of these ships, the Lady Luck, was owned by Lando Calrissian, but many examples were found among veteran spacers after the Battle of Yavin.
The T-6 shuttle is an old transport design used by the Jedi Order and Republic during the Clone Wars. It was modified with additional weapons after the start of the Galactic Civil War.
The Weequay pirate ship is a type of starship used by Weequay pirates during the Clone Wars, and found its way to other scum factions.
The Charubah Corvette is a medium combat ship designed by the Charubah company. It serves as a main military workhorse of the Hapan Consortium for both defence and raiding.
The Cumulus-class Corsair is a type of fast warship used by pirate raiding parties.

The EF76 Nebulon-B escort frigate was built by Kuat Drive Yards for use by the Imperial Navy, to protect convoys from Rebel Alliance starfighter actions. It was, however, used more famously by the Rebellion. While generally well-armed for a vessel of that size, the midsection connecting spar was an exploitable vulnerability. This Escort version is equipped with more anti-fighter weapons.

The EF76 Nebulon-B patrol frigate was built by Kuat Drive Yards for use by the Imperial Navy, to protect convoys from Rebel Alliance starfighter actions. It was, however, used more famously by the Rebellion. While generally well-armed for a vessel of that size, the midsection connecting spar was an exploitable vulnerability. This Patrol version is equipped with more anti-corvette turrets and is used for backwater territory patrols.

Designed years before the outbreak of the Clone Wars, the Acclamator I-class was a common sight alongside the larger Venator-class Star Destroyers. Despite primarily being a transport ship, its heavy weaponry and shielding allowed it to carry troops into enemy systems, break orbital blockades, and land directly on the battlefield to deploy an entire legion of troopers and their vehicles. Though it was phased out of the Imperial Navy, it continues to see service as a heavy freighter among multiple factions,due to the protection offered by its anti-fighter capabilities.

Seeing the need for a more heavily-armed warship within the fleets of the Republic Navy, Rothana Heavy Engineering modified the design of the Acclamator-class Transport. The resulting ship, the Acclamator-II, sacrificed most of the original Acclamator's cargo space for additional weaponry and shielding, and was used by the Republic to carry out orbital bombardments during the Clone Wars. Following the end of that conflict, the Acclamator-II was retired by the Galactic Empire, and now sees service within the fleets of the Corporate Sector Authority.

The AA-9 Freighter-Liner, also known as the AA-9 Coruscant freighter, was a starship produced by Botajef Shipyards which first brought the small shipbuilding concern to galactic prominence. Initially conceived as a freighter, it would go on to be used as a refugee transport and, during the Clone Wars, as a troopship for the Grand Army of the Republic.
The AA-9 Freighter-Liner, also known as the AA-9 Coruscant freighter, was a starship produced by Botajef Shipyards. This is a Gas Miner Refit
The AA-9 Freighter-Liner, also known as the AA-9 Coruscant freighter, was a starship produced by Botajef Shipyards. This is an Ore Miner Refit

The Quasar Fire-class cruiser-carrier, also known as the Quasar Fire-class bulk cruiser, was a starship line built by the SoroSuub Corporation. It was converted into light carrier for the use by Rebels.

The Quasar Fire-class cruiser-carrier II, also known as the Quasar Fire-class bulk cruiser, or simply the Imperial light carrier, was a starship line built by the SoroSuub Corporation. It saw service in the Galactic Empire's Imperial Navy, both as a starfighter carrier and a mobile base of operations.

Produced by Kuat Drive Yards and used heavily by the Republic during the Clone Wars, the Pelta-class frigate was a versatile ship capable of filling multiple roles. Moderately armed, it acted as a support frigate for larger Venator or Acclamator fleets, while its cargo bays and crew quarters allowed it to move supplies or transport troops. One of its primary uses, however, was the transport of injured clone troopers to Republic medical stations for treatment.

Produced by Kuat Drive Yards and used heavily by the Republic during the Clone Wars, the Pelta-class frigate was a versatile ship capable of filling multiple roles. In the years following the war, the Empire retired the majority of these ships. Many years later, as the Galactic Civil War began, several Pelta-class frigates fell into the hands of Rebel forces, which modified them for greater firepower at the cost of cargo storage. Eventually, the New Republic found the modified Pelta frigates to be efficient enough that the modifications were formalized under the Pelta-II designation.

The Class VI Bulk Freighter is a type of cargo hauler originally designed by the Corellian Engineering Corporation. Based on the ancient Praetorian-class Frigate, it has a modest cargo space and impressive speed, but is lightly armed, poorly armoured, and moderately shielded.

The Praetorian-class frigate is a 180-meter long capital ship, durable and powerful for its size. An ancient design from the Old Republic, it has since been modernised to serve as a versatile escort ship, capable of mounting a wide variety of weapons including flak batteries, ion cannons, and devastating mass driver turrets.

A successor and life extension program to the Victory I-class Star Destroyer manufactured by Kuat Drive Yards, the Victory II-class Star Destroyer was redesigned with greater firepower and lower maintenance upkeep. Though many of the previous model's most glaring flaws were corrected, this all-purpose ship never escaped the Victory I's problems in their entirety, and failed to hold up to Imperial standards. Many Victory IIs were assigned to service as defence for a planetary garrison or light patrol duties on the edges of the Galactic Empire's authority. An Imperial officer being assigned to an old Victory II-class was often seen as the end of their career, shuffled off to a backwater world in exile.

The Neutron Star Bulk Cruiser was designed by Rendili StarDrive as a second-line warship for the Republic Navy during the Clone Wars. However, it was already obsolete by the time it was produced, and the defeat of the Separatists meant the Neutron Star never saw combat. Rejected by the Empire, Rendili sold the ship to private interests as patrol vessels in poor sectors and fringe systems.\n\nThis model has been modernised to carry heavy turbolasers, an ion cannon, and a small complement of fighters.

The Neutron Star Bulk Cruiser was designed by Rendili StarDrive as a second-line warship for the Republic Navy during the Clone Wars. However, it was already obsolete by the time it was produced, and the defeat of the Separatists meant the Neutron Star never saw combat. Rejected by the Empire, Rendili sold the ship to private interests as patrol vessels in poor sectors and fringe systems.\n\nThis model has been converted into a freighter, sacrificing its heavy armaments and some shielding for a substantial cargo capacity.

The Hardcell-class interstellar transport, also known simply as the Hardcell transport or Techno Union transport, is a model of transport manufactured by the Techno Union and utilised by the Confederacy of Independent Systems during the First Battle of Geonosis, the opening battle of the Clone Wars. This is a dedicated transport model.
The Hardcell-class frigate is a heavily armed modification of Hardcell-class interstellar transport made to counter enemy corvettes and frigates during escort duties .

The Hardcell-class interstellar transport, also known simply as the Hardcell transport or Techno Union transport, is a model of transport manufactured by the Techno Union and utilised by the Confederacy of Independent Systems during the First Battle of Geonosis, the opening battle of the Clone Wars. This model has been modified for mining operations.

The Hardcell-class interstellar transport, also known simply as the Hardcell transport or Techno Union transport, is a model of transport manufactured by the Techno Union and utilised by the Confederacy of Independent Systems during the First Battle of Geonosis, the opening battle of the Clone Wars. This model has been modified for gas collecting operations.

The C-9979 landing craft, also known as the Trade Federation landing ship or the Separatist landing craft, is a large landing craft built by Haor Chall Engineering for the Trade Federation's military forces, and later for the Confederacy of Independent Systems. After the end of Clone Wars most of them were refitted to serve a transportation role.

The Vindicator-class heavy cruiser is the standard 600-meter-long heavy cruiser design of the Imperial Navy. It is intended for use in situations in which Imperial-class Star Destroyers are unavailable, and smaller ships are not powerful enough. They replaced the Dreadnought-class heavy cruiser as the Navy's standard multi-role cruiser.

The Immobilizer 418 cruiser, also known as the Interdictor, is a 600-meter-long cruiser built on the standard Vindicator-class heavy cruiser hull. Equipped with gravity well projectors designed to pull ships from hyperspace and/or prevent them making the jump to lightspeed, the Interdictor became a valuable addition to the Imperial Navy.

The Dreadnought-class heavy cruiser, or simply the Dreadnought, is a type of capital ship built for planetary occupation and space combat used by the Galactic Republic, Galactic Empire, New Republic, local governments, and various other organisations. It is one of the most ubiquitous ship designs in all of the galaxy.

This type of Dreadnought-class heavy cruiser was used in the Katana Fleet in the waning years of the Galactic Republic, and then lost during a blind hyperspace jump. It has been extensively modified with full-rig slave circuitry to reduce the crew requirements, and almost completely stripped of crew amenities and interior decor.

The Arquitens-class light cruiser, also known as the Jedi light cruiser or Republic light cruiser, is a line of light cruisers designed by Kuat Drive Yards that saw extensive service with the Republic Navy during the Clone Wars. Though relatively small, it boasted a wide array of weaponry and could serve various roles, from fleet escort to reconnaissance picket.

The Imperial Light Cruiser is a starship used by the Galactic Empire. A development and successor to the Arquitens-class light cruiser of the Galactic Republic, the Imperial Light Cruiser served the Imperial Navy in a variety of roles, from patrol duties and armed transportation, to support for larger ships and battlegroups.

The Class 546 Cruiser was a model of light cruiser, though it was also designated as a Lightspeed Cruiser. Though it superficially resembles the earlier Imperial Light Cruiser and Arquitens-class cruisers, it is larger, bulkier, more heavily armed, and can carry a fighter complement in its internal hangar bay.

Enforcer-class cruisers were built on the same 600-meter frame as the Immobilizer 418 cruiser and Vindicator-class heavy cruiser after naval architects removed the massive power generators from an Immobilizer 418 cruiser and discovered that by re-arranging the vessel's power grids, they could enhance the ship's energy weapons and other systems. Even the engines experienced a bonus from this reconfiguration. The end result was a very fast and manoeuvrable vessel that is well armed for a ship its size.

Ships of this type were seemingly of the design philosophy of the Geonosians, and it is believed that engineers from that planet contributed the design of this vessel to the Separatist cause, similar to the better-known Nantex-class territorial defence starfighter. The presence of these vessels at Geonosis during the inception of the Clone Wars seems to confirm this hypothesis.

The Nebulon-C is a class of frigates built by Kuat Drive Yards. In terms of armament, it possessed numerous heavy turbolasers, point-defence laser cannons, tractor beam projectors, and 2 proton torpedo launchers as well as more potent armaments.
The MC40A is a small cruiser built by Mon Calamari Shipyards. It is equipped with powerful shields for a vessel of its size, as well as long range weaponry.

The MC40B is a small cruiser built by Mon Calamari Shipyards. It is equipped with powerful shields for a vessel of its size. Compared to the MC40A, the Torpedo Cruiser had its ion Cannons and concussion missile launchers removed to allow the installation of Heavy Torpedo Launchers.

The Valor-class cruiser is an ancient Old Republic design, restored and modernised by the Anoat Federation. Designed as a fast capital ship, it originally served as the most powerful warship in the Republic fleet during the Great Galactic War, more than three thousand years before the rise of the Galactic Empire. Bristling with medium turbolasers, it stands on level footing with other cruisers, but will struggle and falter under the fire of larger vessels.
The Valor-T is a modification of the modernised Valor-class cruiser. It sacrifices durability and heavy weaponry for a significant cargo capacity.
The Heraklon was once a transport and frigate of the Old Republic Navy. Currently it is repurposed as a utility vessel and for mining operations. This is the ore miner refit.
The Heraklon was once a transport and frigate of the Old Republic Navy. Currently it is repurposed as a utility vessel and for mining operations. This is the gas collector refit.
Terminus is a destroyer used by the Sith forces. Not much is known about capabilities of this ship.
The CYC is a ship produced by the Corellian Engineering Corporation that is used for scrapping capital ship and station wrecks.
The TH1 Hauler is an old civilian freighter used by some commercial shippers.

The Interceptor-class frigate is a makeshift capital ship built from Action-IV freighter hulls. Valued by pirate organisations and syndicates for its high speed and relative firepower, the Interceptor-class frigate excels in quick hit-and-run tactics using a combination of accurate short-range lasers and concussion missile launchers or forward turbolasers.
The Kontos-class Cruiser is a picket-line ship and support ship used by the Ascendancy.

The Cantwell-class Arrestor Cruiser is a type of cruiser manufactured by Kuat Drive Yards. The Cantwell-class Arrestor Cruiser is designed to ensnare and incapacitate any suspect starship, be it a freighter, a frigate or even another cruiser.

Battle Dragons are the primary capital ships of the Hapan Royal Navy. Departing from traditional starship design philosophies, Battle Dragons featured a unique dual saucer-shaped hull, 500 meters in diameter, with a central core connected by sixteen rotation support struts. The ships were armed with many ion cannons and turbolaser batteries affixed to rotating circular sections on the top and bottom hull plates.

The Nova-class battle cruiser is a capital ship that formed a large portion of the Hapan fleet. This 400-meter cruiser often serves as a patrol vessel for the Hapan Consortium's borders, as well as supplementing their primary warship, the Battle Dragon. Their speed and weaponry make them a formidable cruiser for their size.

The Vigil-class corvette is considered the smallest vessel in the iconic Star Destroyer line of ships. Thanks to their size and role, these ships rarely served in the line of battle with larger types of star destroyers. Instead they patrolled trade routes, escorted cruisers as picket ships, served as battlegroup leaders for small backwater fleets, operated as lone cruisers hunting pirates and smugglers, and generally served where a larger destroyer was deemed excessive or wasteful.

The Fulgor-class frigate is a heavy pursuit ship made to protect trading routes. Its hyperdrive is powerful enough to catch up to most corvettes, and its light turbolasers, ion cannons, and concussion missiles can make quick work of the lighter targets used to harass freighter convoys.

Basically an engine with weapons attached, the Velox-class Frigate is able to weave between heavier ship classes inside their formations to disrupt and distract the enemy from the larger fleet vessels. With a wide variety of light and medium weapons, combined with the forward-facing heavy ion cannons, the Velox can even pose a threat to ships of similar or smaller size as part of a picket or patrol.

The Teroch-class cruiser is an older Mandalorian warship design created by MandalHypernautics, and commissioned by Death Watch after their rise to power. Over the course of the Galactic Civil war, it was commonly used as a raiding vessel for small bands of Mandalorian warriors. Its small frame and sizable weaponry make it ideal for hit-and-run tactics.

The Proclamator-class star frigate was an assault ship created prior to the Clone Wars as a short-lived predecessor to the Acclamator-class assault ship. It would see service in the Grand Army of the Republic and Galactic Empire. Though no longer in major military service, modernised hulls can be found among the fleets of the Corporate Sector's navy.
The Lancer-class is a frigate armed with anti-fighter laser cannons that served as a picket ship for Imperial fleets. Though well-armed, it is slow and poorly-protected against capital ships.
The Overseer is a fast response light cruiser designed by Hoersch-Kessel Drive Inc. based on popular Munificent-class design.
The Ordnance Cruiser design as built by Techno Union saw little use in Clone Wars. However, with the reforming of Independent Commerce Guild, it is now used as a heavy escort ship.

The Diamond-class cruiser is a class of warship used by the Commerce Guild and Confederacy of Independent Systems during the Clone Wars. In recent years it has been refitted with additional weaponry, and put into service by the ICG.

Some ship designs suit themselves to multiple purposes. In the case of the Diamond-class vessel, the Commerce Guild used it as both a heavy transport for battle droids and a warship. This is the transport configuration.

The QDF Refractory Frigate is a long-range reconnaissance and observation vessel employed by the Confederate Navy during the Clone Wars. Its surprisingly small sensor cross-section allowed it to sneak behind enemy lines to gather intel or engage in surprise strikes against rear elements.

Following the success of the GR-75 transport in the hands of the Rebel Alliance and the founding of the New Republic, shipwrights from the then-defunct Gallofree Yards, Inc. decided to reform the company and begin producing freighters once again. The GR-500 is a recent development, sold primarily as a freighter.
The GR-500 is a utility vessel developed by Gallofree Yards after the partial success of its GR-75 series among the Rebels and New Republic. This is a solid miner configuration.
The GR-500 is a utility vessel developed by Gallofree Yards after the partial success of its GR-75 series among the Rebels and New Republic. This is a gas collector configuration.

The Storm Commando Carrier, also known as the 'Spector-class Escort Carrier' and 'Imperial Escort Carrier', is a type of capital ship used extensively by the former Galactic Empire's Storm Commandos. Following the collapse of the Empire, this ship has found continued use by various Imperial warlords.

The Storm Commandos demanded something different than the standard escort carrier of the Imperial Navy. The result is a nimble narrow-hulled ship with a flared arrowhead bow, two turrets on the dorsal centerline, a startling number of rear-facing missile racks, and ample hangar space for a ship of its size.

The Storm Commando Carrier relies on speed and high alpha-strike potential to deal quick decisive blows during operations. However, once its missile stores are depleted it is left lightly-armed and armored, leaving it ill-suited to prolonged engagements.

The ancient Dekhara-type vessels date back thousands of years, having reliably served the Sith Lords in their conquest and consolidation of the Sith Sphere. With limited resources available throughout local Sith space, the ship architects have opted to retrofit these ageing workhorses with the latest advancements for upcoming campaigns.

As the Sith rebuild their empire, their logistical needs have grown as well. Efficient shipwrights have chosen to modify the existing Dekhara frame into a freighter, rather than create an entirely new design.
A utility vessel built with modularity in mind to provide logistical support. This is a freighter modification.
A utility vessel built with modularity in mind to provide logistical support. This is a solid miner modification.
A utility vessel built with modularity in mind to provide logistical support. This is a liquid miner modification.

When the ancient Mandalorian Neo-Crusaders conquered and enslaved the people of Basilisk, they stole that peoples' technology and adapted it into terrifying weapons and warships. Among those ships used by Mandalorian fleets to assault the Old Republic was the Jehavey'ir-type assault ship, a vaguely insectoid craft bristling with weapons befitting its Mando'a name: 'ambush'.\n\nIn recent years, MandalMotors engineers have updated and modernized the Jehavey'ir-type. Its missiles and turbolasers make it a formidable foe in any fight.

The Imperial I-class Star Destroyer, designed and built by Kuat Drive Yards, is a wedge-shaped capital ship used heavily by the Galactic Empire as a replacement for the Republic-era Venator. A heavily armed and serious threat to other capital ships, the all-purpose Imperial I-class Star Destroyer boasts a large hangar capacity capable of fielding dozens of starfighters.

The Imperial II-class Star Destroyer is a capital ship model that was derived from the Imperial I-class Star Destroyer. The newer model has a heavily reinforced hull, stronger deflector shields, and greater firepower than the original Imperial I class, though this comes with the loss of some anti-fighter defences and the range of the earlier Star Destroyer.

The MC80 Liberty type Star Cruiser was an early type of Mon Calamari Star Cruiser put into service for the Rebel Alliance during the Galactic Civil War. A common variant of the MC80 Star Cruiser line was exemplified by the cruiser Liberty. It has an array of nine engines, divided into three different sizes, located at the stern. A large wing-shaped superstructure is affixed to the main hull on either side, containing additional weapons pods and shield generators.

The Venator-class Star Destroyer was the backbone of the Galactic Republic's naval forces during the Clone Wars. As the first of the Star Destroyers designed by Kuat Drive Yards, the Venator combined high firepower with a substantial starfighter complement, and often served as a command ship for Jedi generals. Capable of quickly fielding dozens of fighters, the Venator is purpose-built as a carrier first and warship second. While it may not be able to hold its own against some ships of comparable size by itself, the fighters and other support craft it houses can turn the tide of battle.

Following the end of the Clone Wars, the Venator was slowly retired in favour of the Imperial-class Star Destroyer, and scrapped or sold as surplus to a wide variety of corporate and private interests.

This iteration of the Venator is seen among Corporate Sector fleets, and has been modernised with additional shielding and hull reinforcements, which came at the cost of some of its fighter capacity.

The Venator-class Star Destroyer, also known as a Republic attack cruiser or Jedi Cruiser, was the backbone of the Galactic Republic's naval forces during the Clone Wars. As the first of the Star Destroyers designed by Kuat Drive Yards, the Venator combined high firepower with a substantial starfighter complement, and often served as a command ship for Jedi generals.\n\nThis is the original design that took part in the Clone Wars, which has been restored by Kaminoan interests.

The Venator-class Star Destroyer was the backbone of the Galactic Republic's naval forces during the Clone Wars. As the first of the Star Destroyers designed by Kuat Drive Yards, the Venator combined high firepower with a substantial starfighter complement, and often served as a command ship for Jedi generals. Following the end of the Clone Wars, the Venator was slowly retired in favour of the Imperial-class Star Destroyer, and scrapped or sold as surplus to a wide variety of corporate and private interests.\n\nThis model was "acquired" by the Hutt Cartel, which modified the design with increased armour and shields and replaced the original heavy proton torpedo launchers with medium concussion missiles.

Providence-class carrier/destroyers were warships in service to the Confederacy of Independent Systems. Designed by the Quarren Free Dac Volunteers Engineering Corps, the rounded, pseudo-organic design of the Providence was inspired by both the Quarren homeworld of Dac and Rendili StarDrive's Dreadnought-class heavy cruiser. As a carrier it boasts a significant fighter complement, and as a destroyer its arms and armour are impressive, though its moderate speed leaves it lagging behind all but the heaviest warships.

The Munificent-class Star Frigate is a product of Hoersch-Kessel Drive Inc, and is one very few heavy class frigates available on the civilian market. Its skeletal appearance belies a powerful weapons array, including heavy turbolasers and ion cannons in its prow.

The Neutron Star Bulk Cruiser was designed by Rendili StarDrive as a second-line warship for the Republic Navy during the Clone Wars. However, it was already obsolete by the time it was produced, and the defeat of the Separatists meant the Neutron Star never saw combat. Rejected by the Empire, Rendili sold the ship to private interests as patrol vessels in poor sectors and fringe systems.\n\nThis model has been converted into a construction vessel, sacrificing heavy armaments for a reinforced hull and the ability to assemble stations.

The Executor-class Star Dreadnought, colloquially known as the Executor-class Super Star Destroyer, Executor-class Star Destroyer or simply Super Star Destroyer, is a heavy warship class in the Star Dreadnaught league, often used as command ships and flagships in the Imperial Navy. At their prime, they were among the largest vessels in the galaxy, and were almost invincible in combat, although they were costly to operate.
The MC80 Cynosure is the carrier modification of the MC80L that provides carrying capacity as well as better firepower and shielding than the MC80 Reef-class, even if its speed is somewhat lower.

The Keldabe-class battleship was one of several different warship classes utilised by the Mandalorians and other factions during the Galactic Civil War. A Mandal Hypernautics design, like the Crusader-class corvette, the Keldabe is named for Mandalore's former capital. The battleship design was marked by sharp edges similar to the ancient Mandalorian Kandosii-type dreadnaught, and bristles with devastating weaponry.

The Harbor-class is a huge fleet resupply ship designed and constructed by Rendili StarDrive. Originally produced during the Clone Wars, this auxiliary ship has seen wide use across the galaxy in the years since.

The MC80 Reef is one of early models among Mon Calamari ships. Due to mediocre weaponry and slightly lower survivability, it served mostly as a fleet support vessel, or for hit-and-run raids on less guarded Empire outposts, though its fighter complement is still quite impressive.
This is the civilian liner built by Mon Calamari, many such ships were modified early during the Galactic Civil War to serve as star cruisers and fight the Galactic Empire.

Needing a dedicated auxiliary ship to assist with in-field repairs and replenishment, the Rebel Alliance, and later the New Republic, commissioned the Mon Calamari shipyards to build the Mon Calamari Fleet Support vessel. Based on the reliable design of the Mon Calamari Liner, the Fleet Support variant has docking capabilities for other capital vessels and a larger cargo hold, allowing it to repair and replenish any ship in its fleet without the use of a dedicated shipyard.

The Harrower-class dreadnaught, known more infrequently as the Harrower-class battle cruiser, was a heavily-armed class of wedge-shaped capital ship that was the backbone of the Imperial Navy of the reconstituted Sith Empire during the Great Galactic War, the Cold War, and the Galactic War with the Galactic Republic. This model is a heavily modified and upscaled version of the old Sith ship.
While visually almost identical to the Harrower-class Star Destroyer, not much is known about this ship.

The Procursator-class Star Destroyer is an Imperial warship in the Star Destroyer design family. It is a bit smaller and sacrifices fighter carrying capability for good armour and a powerful reactor to feed its main armament.

The MC80 Home One, also known as the MC80 Command Cruiser was one of the several MC80 Star Cruiser designs built by the Mon Calamari. Originally fielded before the Galactic Civil War as civilian vessels, they were modified by the Rebel Alliance, and served in command ship and battleship roles in the Alliance Fleet.

The MC75 Star Cruiser, also referred to as the MC75 modified star cruiser, was a model of Star Cruiser in the service of the Alliance Fleet. One such ship, the Profundity, served as Admiral Raddus's flagship during the pivotal Battle of Scarif. Other examples included the Aspiration, the Accordance, and the Temperance. In contrast to later Mon Calamari veseels, these ships were more heavily armoured and carried heavy proton torpedo launchers, but lacked in fighter capacity and direct firepower.

The Lucrehulk-class refers to many types of Hoersch-Kessel Drive, Inc.'s starships used by the Trade Federation.\nThis is a Control/Auxiliary variant used mostly as a command ship and carrier for prolonged operations.

The Lucrehulk-class refers to many types of Hoersch-Kessel Drive, Inc.'s starships used by the Trade Federation.\nThis is the Battleship variant, with additional hull plating and additional weapons and weapon generators at the cost of cargo hold space.
This is original Lucrehulk LH-3210 Freighter, capable of moving stock of a whole station in one go.

The Recusant-class destroyer, commonly referred to as the Commerce Guild destroyer, is a class of starship heavily used by the CIS Navy during the Clone Wars and Independent Commerce Guild after the fall of Empire.

The Kandosii-type dreadnaught, named after the Mando'a word for "indomitable", is the largest capital ship used by the Mandalorians. They are heavily armed for long range combat and carry a large fighter complement, often functioning as a mobile HQ. An ancient warship, the original craft were constructed from stolen parts and technology and used by Mandalorian Neo-Crusaders during the Mandalorian Wars, four thousand years before the rise of the Galactic Empire. Modernisation has also standardized the design

The Bellator-class Dreadnaught is a divergent design in the Mandator-series of Star Dreadnaught that served as a warship in the Imperial Navy. It is a class of large-scale dreadnaught that was manufactured by Kuat Drive Yards and served as a flagship in numerous Imperial fleets across the galaxy during the reign of Emperor Palpatine. Thanks to recent conflicts, a shortage of materials and manpower, and the destruction or capture of key shipyards, few Bellators remain in service.

The prototype of the class of Super Star Destroyer that eventually became the Executor-class Star Dreadnaught. This schematic was acquired by criminal lords after fall of the Empire and sold to interested parties. While it lacks many of the improvements implemented in the final version of the Executor, it is still a formidable warship.

The Praetor-class battle cruiser is a warship that was produced by Kuat Drive Yards in the final years of the Galactic Republic. Examples of the class seen today have been refurbished to serve in wealthy militias and corporate security forces.

Far beyond the Core in the reaches of the outer rim, the Clone Wars never ended. In the ongoing conflict between the Corporate Sector Authority and the Independent Commerce Guild, new ship designs have begun appearing as evolutions of decades-old warfare.\nThe Allocator is a newer design in the Commerce Guild fleet, with a focus on direct ship-to-ship firepower developed specifically to fight similarly new threats from the Corporate Sector.

Following the Battle of Endor and the formation of the New Republic, the Mon Calamari Shipyards and Corellian Engineering Corporation cooperated to develop a new frontline warship for a multi-species navy. The resulting ship, the MC85 Star Cruiser, is a massive battleship intended to be a defensive keystone in New Republic fleets. Rather than being a repurposed civilian ship, like the MC80 line, the MC85 was designed from the start to engage in direct ship-to-ship combat.\n\nA robust and sturdy platform, this cruiser utilizes heavy weaponry and advanced shielding. Keeping with the New Republic doctrine of force projection through versatility, the MC85 also boasts large inset hangars, allowing it to carry a full complement of fighters.

In the early months of the Clone Wars, the Republic Navy was plagued by a new and terrifying threat: a Subjugator-class Battlecruiser, the Malevolence. Initially the Republic had difficulty in tracking the Malevolence as its advanced axial Ion Cannons were capable of projecting a massive blast which disabled any vessel caught in its wake, and even entire fleets of Republic Star Destroyers fell to the following barrage of missiles and laser fire. The Republic's first several encounters with the Malevolence resulted in a complete loss of Republic assets, and only a handful of survivors. However, with the intelligence acquired by those survivors, Republic forces under General Anakin Skywalker were able to disable the Malevolence with a large-scale bomber strike, and on-board sabotage forced the ship to crash into the Dead Moon of Antar, finally destroying it.\n\nDespite being wildly successful in its first engagements, the Separatists kept their remaining Subjugators away from the frontlines except as a last result, fearing additional losses of these resource-intensive ships; those remaining Subjugators disappeared entirely after the Clone Wars. Following the end of the Galactic Civil War, and the growing hostilities between the Corporate Sector Authority and Independent Commerce Guild, it has been rumored that these massive ships have once again been seen in supermassive shipyards.
Laser-based mining drill that sends seismic waves into the asteroids and crushes them, used across the galaxy.

The L-s1 laser cannon is a laser cannon developed and manufactured by Sienar Fleet Systems. Before 0 BBY, TIE/ln space superiority starfighters were usually equipped with a pair of L-s1s. The L-s1 was eventually surpassed by the L-s7.2 laser cannon, which solved the L-s1's problem of overheating by adding coolant modifications; however, the L-s1 still remains popular among young spacers, as it is not only very cheap but is becoming more widely available as a result of the Empire's slow but steady fracturing after the disaster at Endor.

The KX5 laser cannon is a laser cannon developed and manufactured by the Taim and Bak Corporation. It is a viable alternative to the standard-issue IX-4 laser cannons found on BTL-A4 Y-wing assault starfighter/bombers and RZ-1 A-Wings. They are also commonly seen on Z-95 Headhunter starfighters.

The KX7 laser cannon is a laser cannon developed and manufactured by the Taim and Bak Corporation. Most commonly seen on UT-60D U-wing support ships and Zeta-class cargo shuttles, it is more pricey, but certainly more powerful, than the KX5.

The KX10 laser cannon is a laser cannon developed and manufactured by the Taim and Bak Corporation. The most powerful of the KX-series of weapons systems, this design can easily ensure a pilot's victory in a dogfight several times over, and, if the user is smart enough, is capable of seriously damaging or even crippling a light corvette. However, it has a shorter range than the KX7, and overheats much faster.

Developed and manufactured by the Taim and Bak Corporation, the XX-80 is an octuple barbette turbolaser design usually found on Imperial II-class Star Destroyers and other heavy warships and stations. While it suffers from a slow turning rate, its long range and sheer damage output readily compensates for this weakness.

The Corellian Engineering Corporation-produced AG-2G quad laser cannon is a powerful laser cannon, best suited for anti-starfighter defence. One of these laser turrets was installed on the top of the Millennium Falcon by Lando Calrissian and modified by Han Solo, the latter of whom also added the ventral cannons.
The Corellian Engineering Corporation-produced AG-1G laser cannon is a basic point-defence laser cannon.

The H9 turbolaser is a shipboard emplacement weapon produced by the Taim and Bak Corporation. Usually seen on CR90 corvettes, they are reasonably powerful for their small size but struggle against anything that isn't another corvette, and are best used in an anti-starfighter role. This is the dual-barrel configuration.

The H9 turbolaser is a shipboard emplacement weapon produced by the Taim and Bak Corporation. Usually seen on CR90 corvettes, they are reasonably powerful for their small size but struggle against anything that isn't another corvette, and are best used in an anti-starfighter role. This is the single-barrel configuration.

The H9 turbolaser is a shipboard emplacement weapon produced by the Taim and Bak Corporation. Usually seen on CR90 corvettes, they are reasonably powerful for their small size but struggle against anything that isn't another corvette, and are best used in an anti-starfighter role. This is the quad-barrel configuration.

The XX-9 heavy turbolaser is a heavy shipboard emplacement weapon produced by the Taim and Bak Corporation and is the main turbolaser type seen on medium and large warships, where it excels in medium-range engagements. This is the dual-barrel configuration.

The XX-9 heavy turbolaser is a heavy shipboard emplacement weapon produced by the Taim and Bak Corporation and is the main turbolaser type seen on medium and large warships, where it excels in medium-range engagements. This is the single-barrel configuration.

The SW-7a light ion cannon is a starfighter-mounted ion cannon manufactured by the ArMek Corporation. Used for disabling a target's shields and short-circuiting their internal systems, including their engines. When used by the right pilot, it is capable of disabling anything from starfighters to small warships. The Slayn and Korpil-designed A/SF-01 B-wing heavy assault starfighter featured three SW-7a cannons as part of its armament.

The KX5 laser cannon is a laser cannon developed by the Taim and Bak corporation. It could be used as an alternative to IX4 laser cannons on BTL-A4 Y-wing assault starfighter/bombers. They were also used on Z-95 Headhunter starfighters.

The KX7 laser cannon is a laser cannon developed and manufactured by the Taim and Bak Corporation. Most commonly seen on UT-60D U-wing support ships and Zeta-class cargo shuttles, it is more pricey, but certainly more powerful, than the KX5.
A popular starfighter-mounted warhead launcher developed by Krupx Munitions. It can house light proton torpedoes, concussion missiles, or ion torpedoes.

The L-s7.2 laser cannon is mass produced in the Wakeelmui system, and is considered the standard laser cannon used on Sienar Fleet Systems' TIE Series as of the Battle of Endor. It features several improvements over the older L-s1, chief of which are its higher damage output, higher rate of fire, and better coolant systems.

More destructive than the slightly older but more common L-s7.2 laser cannon, the L-s9.3 had the power to destroy small asteroids in one shot. Developed by Sienar Fleet Systems to provide additional firepower against shielded Rebel fighters, the L-s9.3 was most notably used as the primary armament of the Imperial TIE/IN interceptor. However, it was also commonly found on the TIE/ad Avenger and the TIE/D Defender. It could also be fitted to the TIE Advanced x1 and even standard TIE/LNs.
A Taim and Bak-produced dual heavy turbolaser turret, usually installed on warships as their main anti-capital weapons. Best used in long-range engagements.
A Taim and Bak-produced dual-barreled heavy turbolaser turret that is similar to the XX-18, usually installed on warships as their main anti-capital weapons. Best used in long-range engagements.

The Borstel Galactic Defense-produced NK-7 ion cannon is a powerful ship-based weapon used on Imperial capital ships, especially Imperial Star Destroyers. Each emplacement has its own turbine generator and is controlled by gunnery stations inside the ship. Used for disabling the shields and engines of another capital ship. A volley from these weapons can disable a ship for several minutes. Components of the NK-7 include an ion tube, ion accu-accelerator, turbine generators, cooling grid, targeting computers, elevation tracking, and maintenance access hatches.
The Borstel Galactic Defense-produced NK-5 ion cannon is a powerful ion cannon used on Imperial capital ships.
A heavier variant of the Krupx Warhead Launcher that can be fitted to medium-sized warships. Capable of carrying heavier and more powerful payloads.
General-purpose point defence light laser turret installed on starships and stations for anti-starfighter defence.
Clone-war era point defence general-purpose light laser turret installed on starships and stations for anti-starfighter defence.
Quad-barreled general-purpose heavy laser turret installed on starships and stations for anti-starfighter defence.

The NK-3 ion cannon is a type of starfighter-scale ion cannon that is manufactured by Borstel Galactic Defense and is more powerful than the SW-7a. Used for disabling the shields and engines of a target.
The T-s5 proton torpedo launcher is manufactured by Sienar Fleet Systems for use in the TIE/sa bomber, which also contains an M-s3 concussion missile launcher in its ordnance pod.
The M-g-2 general-purpose warhead launcher is manufactured by Sienar Fleet Systems for use in the TIE/x1 Advanced, TIE/ad Avenger, and TIE/D Defender.
Mining laser turret used to crack open large asteroids for the purpose of mining resources such as silicon.
The SW-7 ion cannon is manufactured by ArMek. It is a powerful weapon found on medium and heavy warships. Used for disabling the shields and engines of medium to heavy warships.
The SW-7-HOI ion cannon is a heavier version of SW-7 manufactured by ArMek, usually installed on Mon Calamari capital ships. Used for disabling the shields and engines of medium to heavy warships.
The XV9 turbolaser is a shipboard emplacement weapon produced by the Taim and Bak Corporation. This heavy-duty turbolaser is commonly found aboard a variety of capital ships.

The RG-9 laser cannon is a model of laser cannon manufactured by Borstel Galactic Defense. It has an extended gimbal for better target tracking. However, it suffers from low damage output and a somewhat short range.
The MG9 proton torpedo launcher is manufactured by Krupx Munitions. Can only hold proton torpedoes.
The HM-6 Concussion Missile Launcher is a type of concussion missile launcher commonly found on the RZ-1 A-wing interceptor. They are manufactured by Dymek.

The SW-4 is a dual ion cannon manufactured by ArMek during the early years of the Galactic Empire. It is most commonly found on BTL-series Y-wing starfighters used by the Alliance to Restore the Republic.
The XV7 is a Taim and Bak-produced light dual-barreled turbolaser. Effective at relatively short ranges and possesses decent damage output. It can be mounted on select station modules.
The XV7's bigger cousin. Able to be mounted on medium-size warships, the XV8 is a medium-range dual-barreled turbolaser that is reasonably powerful for its size.
