Heavy turbolaser cannon commonly seen on the bows of Munificent-class Star Frigates. A powerful weapon that is held back somewhat by a relatively short range.

Heavy ion cannon commonly seen on the bows of Munificent-class Star Frigates. Excels at quickly disabling the shields and engines of a similarly-sized ship, but like its turbolaser counterpart, held back somewhat by a relatively short range.

The R-T0 is a twin laser cannon designed by ArMek that is commonly mounted on the aft turret of Lambda-class T-4a shuttles. It is an effective anti-starfighter weapon, reasonably powerful for both the Lambda's size and its own.
Dual-barreled long range laser turret installed on starships and stations as anti-starfighter defence.
The IX-4 is produced by the Taim and Bak Corporation and is older than the KX5. However, it is still a formidable starfighter-scale weapon, boasting respectable firepower and range.

The IX-8 was an attempt by the Taim and Bak Corporation to improve and modernise the IX-4. However, its only improvement over the IX-4 ended up being its higher damage output, and it overheats faster, leading the company to quickly discontinue the IX-8 in favour of developing and manufacturing the more modern KX-series of laser cannons. Nevertheless, many spacers and factions seem to have found a use for it.

The Taim and Bak-produced MS-1 is infamous for being the primary armament of the Empire's All Terrain Armoured Transports, and many factions took to mounting it on starfighters due to its low cost and resistance to overheating. However, its damage output in dogfights is underwhelming.
The MS-1's bigger brother, now specifically designed for starfighters. Significantly improved damage output while still being resistant to overheating.
The third and final product in the MS-series of laser cannons, the MS-3 features a significantly longer range and higher damage output than the MS-2b.
Produced by the Taim and Bak Corporation, the KX20-B is a heavy laser cannon typically mounted on fast attack craft and corvettes. Has a respectable damage output but a relatively short range.

The Taim and Bak-produced XV1 prow turbolaser is a powerful bow-mounted weapon that is commonly seen on corvettes such as the Defender-class and the more offensive-minded variants of the Gozanti-class cruiser. Has a respectable range but is held back by its tendency to overheat quickly.

The GA-60s is a heavy laser cannon produced by one of the Empire's nationalised corporations. It is relatively weak, and is further held back by a short range for its size, but thanks to advanced technology and cooling systems it seldom overheats during a pitched fight, and is excellent at beating down a target's shields.

The KV22 heavy repeating laser cannon is manufactured by one of the many corporations that currently reside within the Corporate Sector. Despite its relatively low damage output and short range, its nature as a repeater allows it to do much damage to a target. It is also slow to overheat. Best used in hit-and-fade attacks.

The HS-10 is a heavy laser cannon manufactured by the resurgent Techno Union, and is used on medium-size ships fielded by both Union and Commerce Guild forces. Is held back by a somewhat short maximum range, but boasts a decent damage output for its size and is slow to overheat.

A mass driver Chaingun is a ship-mounted weapon that launches solid projectiles at breakneck speeds towards a target, typically by rapidly accelerating the projectile via electromagnetism as it leaves the cannon's barrel. Some mass drivers, such as this one originally produced by MandalMotors, are fed projectiles via a magazine system, allowing the cannon to fire at a reasonably fast rate before the barrel needs to cool down. Mass drivers are able to seriously damage a starship's hull because of their nature as projectile weapons.
The XX3 prow turbolaser is produced by the Taim and Bak Corporation exclusively for the Empire. While similar to the XV1, it has a slightly longer range and is better resistant to overheating.
The E-X is a heavy blaster cannon found on anti-personnel vehicles and small fighters.
A missile rack allows for the mounting of additional missiles on a starship.
Modernised version of DBY-24 medium turbolaser. Can be mounted only on Venator Star Destroyers.
The A-2 ion cannon is manufactured by ArMek and is designed for small fighters. Capable of disabling the shields and engines of other small fighters but not very useful beyond that role.
Dual-barreled general-purpose long-range laser turret installed on starships and stations as anti-starfighter defence.
Flak cannons are the most effective anti-starfighter weapons. The Lancer is a corvette-scale quad-barreled flak turret.
Taim and Bak-produced corvette-scale dual-barreled turbolaser turret. Decent damage output with an above average range. It can be installed on select station modules as a defence weapon.
General-purpose light laser turret installed on starships and stations as anti-starfighter defence.
General-purpose light laser turret installed on starships and stations as anti-starfighter defence.
The X18 is a single-barreled heavy turbolaser turret that boasts both a decent damage output and a respectable range for its size.

The KK-22 is manufactured by BlasTech Industries and is usually found on warships belonging to the Alliance to Restore the Republic and its loyalist star systems. Boasts a decent range and high damage output for its size.
Manufactured by the Taim and Bak Corporation, the XX-20 is commonly found on Imperial-class Star Destroyers. High damage output and decent range for its size.
The KDD300 is manufactured by one of the Empire's nationalised corporations, and is commonly found installed on heavy warships.

The TM8 is a quad-barreled heavy turbolaser produced by the Techno Union and is commonly found installed on ships used by Techno Union and Commerce Guild forces. Boasts a high damage output and a decent range.

The DBY-827 is a heavy dual-barreled turbolaser manufactured by the Taim and Bak Corporation. Made famous for its use aboard Venator-class Star Destroyers during the Clone Wars, its high damage output and nature as a long-range weapon ensured that it would remain a common sight throughout the galaxy years after the Clone Wars' conclusion.
The V-50 dual-barreled turret is a long range ion cannon usually mounted on capital ships.
An upscaled variant of the V-200 manufactured exclusively for the Empire. Its damage output is higher but its maximum range is the same as the V-100.

The SW10-2 is a heavy dual-barreled ion cannon manufactured by ArMek and commonly used by the Alliance to Restore the Republic. High damage output and decent range. Used for disabling the shields and engines of large capital ships.
The A-4 is manufactured by ArMek industries and is best suited for disabling the shields and engines of medium-size capital ships.

The MM-1 is a medium ion cannon manufactured by one of the many corporations that currently reside within the Corporate Sector. Boasting an exceptionally long range for its size, it is used to disable the shields and engines of medium-size capital ships.
The XI7 is a medium turbolaser manufactured by the Taim and Bak Corporation, featuring a decent damage output and exceptionally long range for a weapon of its size.
The HX1 is manufactured by the Taim and Bak Corporation and used almost exclusively by the Alliance to Restore the Republic. It boasts a high damage output and a decent maximum range.
The D6 is a medium dual-barreled turbolaser manufactured by one of the Empire's nationalised corporations. It boasts a high damage output and long range for its size.
Modernised variant of the HX4 produced exclusively for Imperial use. Slightly better range and damage output.
Medium dual-barreled turbolaser manufactured by the Techno Union. Decent damage output coupled with an exceptionally long range for its size.
Clone Wars-era counterpart to the more modern DBY-44. Boasts better shield damage but suffers from lower hull damage. Can be mounted only on Venator-class Star Destroyers.
Dual-barreled heavy turbolaser manufactured by Kuat Drive Yards. It has slightly lower damage output than other heavy turbolasers but has the longest maximum range in its class.
Medium quad-barreled turbolaser manufactured by Kuat Drive Yards. High damage output that is held back by a relatively short range.
Medium dual-barreled rapid-fire turbolaser with a mediocre damage output and range. Manufactured by various companies.
Flak turret designed for use aboard heavy capital ships. Used as area anti-starfighter defence.
Rapid-fire laser cannon that is commonly seen on heavy fighters or patrol craft such as the Firespray-31.
Clone Wars-era weapon installed on Republic fighters. Slightly better against shields but lower direct hull damage.
Clone Wars-era weapon typically found on Republic gunships. Slightly better against shields but lower direct hull damage.
A more modern version of the Clone Wars-era DBY-24 dual-barreled turbolaser, now able to be mounted on many heavy capital ships. Boasts better shield damage but suffers from lower hull damage.
The D10 is a long-range medium single-barreled turbolaser manufactured by one of the Empire's nationalised corporations. It has the longest range for its weapon class on the market.
The D8 is a medium single-barreled turbolaser manufactured by one of the Empire's nationalised corporations. It boasts a high damage output and long range for its size.
Turbolaser manufactured by Mandal Motors. In contrast to other models available on market, the MoH-2 has a higher fire rate and range but lower per-projectile damage.

The Mandalorians have improved mass driver technology to allow their ships to fire dense metallic slugs with high speed and accuracy. A unique weapon due to its ability to partially bypass shields, it can be very dangerous to ships with fragile frames.

An ion cannon manufactured by MandalMotors. Due to unique socket requirements, it is usually not compatible with non-MandalMotors ships, which makes such ships challenging to outfit in other sectors of the galaxy.
Single long-range medium-power turbolaser designed to be installed on slow fire support platforms, such as Dreadnought Heavy Cruisers.

The XX2 is a Taim and Bak-produced light dual-barreled turbolaser specifically for Imperial corvettes. Effective at relatively short ranges and possessing decent damage output. It can also be mounted to certain station modules.
The QF4 is a light quad-barreled turbolaser used as an anti-corvette weapon on Imperial medium warships.

The DB-6 is a light dual-barreled turbolaser used by the Republic during the Clone Wars. Though it is rarely used by the wider galaxy anymore, it can still be mounted to many starships and select station modules.
Triple-barreled heavy turbolaser manufactured by Kuat Drive Yards. Designed for long range suppressive bombardment of stations and enemy capital ships.
H-15 is a turbolaser designed by CEC for use on its medium-sized corvettes. Designed to to quickly break through armour when a target's shields are down.
Heavy laser turret developed by CEC and installed on medium starships for anti-starfighter defence.
Heavy remote laser turret developed by CEC and installed on medium starships for anti-starfighter defence.
Light laser turret developed for and installed on fighters.
Heavy laser cannons designed to overwhelm heavy rebel fighters due to its superior range and punch.
The V-100 heavy ion cannon is a capital-scale ion weapon with a long range, it is used for disabling the shields and engines of other capital ships.
The MZ-22 is the latest development.
A dual-barreled short range laser turret with increased projectile speed. It can commonly be found on starships and stations as anti-fighter defence.
A quad-barreled short range laser turret with increased projectile speed. It can commonly be found on starships and stations as anti-fighter defence.
Yuuzhan-Vong weapon system based on bioplasma technology.
Yuuzhan-Vong weapon system based on bioplasma technology.
The ARX heavy laser cannon was designed by Incom Corporation specifically for Arc-170 starfighter. Combining good rate of fire and firepower, they were the key to success of the starfighter.
The DCL twin laser turret is used for anti-starfighter defence.
Heavy turbolaser cannon specifically designed for Recusant Destroyer.
AM Heavy Laser Cannon is an attempt by MandalMotors to create a powerful anti-fighter laser cannon for medium sized gunboats.
Light twin laser cannon developed by MandalMotors.

The KDD2055 is manufactured by one of the Empire's nationalised corporations, and is commonly found installed on defence platforms and space stations. Though it fires rapidly compared to other weapons of its class, its power output and range are low.

A station battery that is commonly found installed on defence platforms and space stations. Though it fires slowly compared to other station batteries, it boasts a modest range and packs a major punch.

A station battery that is commonly found installed on defence platforms and space stations. Though it boasts high damage and a substantial range, it cannot fire very quickly compared to other batteries of its class.
A Clone-era station battery that is commonly found installed on defence platforms and space stations. Its high fire rate is offset by its relatively low range.
A Mass Driver station battery that is commonly found installed on the space stations of pirates and Mandalorians. Its high velocity projectiles can penetrate shields at high range.
A moderately powerful laser cannon designed by Taim Corporation, usually installed on light fighters.
A rapid-fire space-superiority quad laser cannon designed by Taim Corporation, its lacklustre range is overshadowed by immense fire rate. When used on fast interceptors, it can shred enemy targets.
The MoH-88 is a unique Mandalorian design of heavy long-range turbolaser that was installed on the Kandosii Dreadnaught and some defence installations.

While it has somewhat longer engagement range, it suffers from old turbolaser technology that the Hapan Consortium has used for centuries. Its damage potential is limited compared to other faction weaponry.

An ion cannon manufactured by the Hapes Consortium. Due to unique socket requirements it is usually not compatible with non-Hapan ships, which makes such ships difficult to outfit in other sectors of the galaxy.
Hapan Turbolaser Cannon usually seen on Hapan Nova Battlecruiser.
Hapan Ion Cannon usually seen on Hapan Nova Battlecruiser.
Ion Cannon usually mounted on large warships.
Quad Turbolaser configured for lower damage but increased accuracy.

A quad-barreled heavy turbolaser manufactured by Kuat Drive Yards, configured for long-range engagements and constant fire rate. This model uses a standard turret cap that fits on top or bottom of a ship's hull.

A quad-barreled heavy turbolaser manufactured by Kuat Drive Yards, configured for long-range engagements and constant fire rate. This model is mounted in a ball turret that fits within the trenches of large battlecruisers and dreadnaughts.
Heavy turbolaser turrets specifically designed for extremely long-range engagements, usually mounted on planetary installations, space stations or dreadnought-size vessels.

Heavy turbolaser turrets used on Bellator-class battlecruisers, specifically designed for long-range engagements with low power requirements. While their damage potential per shot is lower than that of comparable weapon systems, they provide a constant barrage of fire on distant targets, making it harder for the target to recover shields and evade.
Long range dual turbolaser turret developed by HKD for ship to ship combat.
Medium turbolaser turrets usually used on Sith ships.
This massive broadside ion cannon is fitted exclusively to the Subjugator-class Battle Cruiser, and is capable of damaging and disabling
Corvette-scale concussion missile launcher. Holds medium-sized payloads.
Concussion missile launcher designed for medium and large capital ships. Holds large payloads.
An array of multiple missile tubes.
Corvette-scale proton torpedo launcher. Holds medium-sized payloads.
Proton torpedo launcher designed for medium and large capital ships. Holds large payloads.
The Flex Tube proton torpedo launcher is a proton torpedo launcher manufactured by Arakyd Industries.
Starfighter-scale concussion missile launcher. Holds small payloads.

The Phylon Q7 tractor beam projector is produced by Phylon Transport, a well-known company specialising in tractor beams. Most famous for its use aboard Imperial-class Star Destroyers, these projectors are able to hold all but the heaviest capital ships in place, and can be fitted to other similarly-sized warships as well.
The Phylon Q7 tractor beam projector is produced by Phylon Transport, a well-known company specialising in tractor beams. This one is usually installed on Cantwell Arrestor-class Cruisers.
The Phylon Q5 tractor beam projector is produced by Phylon Transport and is essentially a smaller, less capable version of the Q7, designed to be mounted on medium-size warships.
The Phylon Q3 projector is a low-power tractor beam installed on small spacecraft to help them move cargo around or slow down their target.
A launching apparatus that launches seismic charges. Best fitted to the back of a starship in case of a hot pursuit.

A gravity well projector is a powerful device affixed to an interdictor vessel used to pull ships out of hyperspace. As a ship could not usually enter hyperspace when within a planet's gravitational pull, the gravity well projector mimicked the effect by creating a strong artificial gravity well known as an interdiction field.
The M-F-1 Concussion warhead launcher is manufactured by Sienar Fleet Systems.
This is a simple weapon system to used to launch unguided proton bombs.
System designed to launch MS-15 Diamond-Boron Cruise Missile

The EP-750X EMP missile launcher is a type of missile launcher produced by Merr-Sonn Munitions, Inc., they fire guided missiles that were tipped with EMP warheads that delivered a powerful ion blast upon detonation, and were, as a result, effective against massed droid formations, as well as effective anti-ship and anti-vehicle weapons.
This launcher is used on some capital ships.
This launcher is used with light unguided rockets.
This launcher is used with medium unguided rockets.

A concussion missile is one of the most commonplace projectile weapons in the galaxy. Although they are not as destructive as proton torpedoes, concussion missiles are still capable of beating down and piercing a target's shields. The ST2 is a starfighter-scale concussion missile produced by Arakyd Industries that is best used against other starfighters.

A small booster rod that deploys a cylindrical cluster of several downscaled ST2 concussion missiles attached to its center shortly after being launched from a starfighter. Best used when engaging multiple starfighters.

A concussion missile is one of the most commonplace projectile weapons in the galaxy. Although they are not as destructive as proton torpedoes, concussion missiles are still capable of beating down and piercing a target's shields. The ST3 is a corvette-scale concussion missile produced by Arakyd Industries. Best used against other corvettes.

A concussion missile is one of the most commonplace projectile weapons in the galaxy. Although they are not as destructive as proton torpedoes, concussion missiles are still capable of beating down and piercing a target's shields. The ST4 is a capital-scale concussion missile produced by Arakyd Industries. Best used against other large capital ships.

A large booster rod that deploys a cylindrical cluster of several downscaled ST4 concussion missiles attached to its center shortly after being launched from a capital ship. Best used when engaging multiple large capital ships.

A proton torpedo is a compact but highly destructive nuclear missile, able to essentially burn right through a target's shields and cause significant damage to its hull. They are generally used against both starfighters and larger warships. The MG7-A is a starfighter-scale proton torpedo produced by Krupx Munitions.

A proton torpedo is a compact but highly destructive nuclear missile, able to essentially burn right through a target's shields and cause significant damage to its hull. They are generally used against both starfighters and larger warships. The MG4-A is a corvette-scale proton torpedo produced by Krupx Munitions.

A proton torpedo is a compact but highly destructive nuclear missile, able to essentially burn right through a target's shields and cause significant damage to its hull. They are generally used against both starfighters and larger warships. The MG1-A is a capital-scale proton torpedo produced by Krupx Munitions.

An ion torpedo is a missile that, as the name suggests, carries an intense ion charge, and is capable of disabling a craft's shields and even temporarily crippling its subsystems, including its engines. Generally, they are effective against both starfighters and larger warships. The 10-IMs is a starfighter-scale ion torpedo produced by Merr-Sonn Munitions, Incorporated.

An ion torpedo is a missile that, as the name suggests, carries an intense ion charge, and is capable of disabling a craft's shields and even temporarily crippling its subsystems, including its engines. Generally, they are effective against both starfighters and larger warships. The 10-IMm is a corvette-scale ion torpedo produced by Merr-Sonn Munitions, Incorporated.

A rocket, also known as a dumbfire missile, is a concussion missile that has no internal guidance systems, and travels in a straight line when launched from a starship. Their key advantage over conventional concussion missiles is that several can be fired in rapid succession. Rockets are incredibly basic weapons, with a typical rocket's method of propulsion being a chemical explosion that is then forced out of its nozzle, and can be traced all the way back to antiquity. This also makes them extremely easy to manufacture, and as such they can be found all across the galaxy, most often sold in bulk.

A rocket, also known as a dumbfire missile, is a concussion missile that has no internal guidance systems, and travels in a straight line when launched from a starship. Their key advantage over conventional concussion missiles is that several can be fired in rapid succession. Rockets are incredibly basic weapons, with a typical rocket's method of propulsion being a chemical explosion that is then forced out of its nozzle, and can be traced all the way back to antiquity. This also makes them extremely easy to manufacture, and as such they can be found all across the galaxy, most often sold in bulk.

A carbonite missile is a missile that, on impact, freezes a section of a starship's hull in carbonite, causing it to become brittle. Deals damage over time. Sold at equipment docks or wharfs belonging to a Mandalorian faction.

A discord missile, nicknamed the Blue Streak for its blue exhaust trail, is a missile whose payload is seven Pistoeka sabotage droids; when deployed from the missile, these droids attach themselves to, and can wreak havoc on, a starship's hull, doing considerable amounts of damage over time. Interestingly, the discord missile seems to have exceptionally intelligent internal guidance systems, as the missile uses external manoeuvring thrusters to "steer" itself out of the way of incoming enemy point-defence fire, and can outmanoeuvre most starfighters. Sold at wharfs or equipment docks belonging to the Techno Union or Independent Commerce Guild.

A diamond-boron missile is a missile protected by armour plating composed of a diamond-boron compound. This armour, while incredibly expensive, is able to harmlessly deflect starfighter-scale blaster fire. This cruise missile can inflict extreme amount of damage on long range.
These Proton Bombs are short-range, unguided explosives fired in a wide scatter. Their shield penetration makes them as effective against capital ships as stations.
Missile used in EP-750X EMP missile launcher.

A seismic charge, also known as a sonic mine, is a bomb that when deployed by a starship is able to destroy or seriously damage anything caught in its destructive shockwave. The Void-7 is produced by Krupx Munitions and can only be launched by a starship that can mount a dedicated seismic charge launching apparatus, such as the Firespray-31.
On explosion will decrease speed and manoeuvrability of S and M ships, effect on L and XL ships is limited.
On explosion will severely decrease speed and manoeuvrability of S and M ships. L and XL ships suffer moderate effect.
On hit will decrease speed and manoeuvrability of S ships, M ships are effected less, has no effect on larger ships.
On hit will decrease speed and manoeuvrability of S and M ships, has limited effect on L and XL ships.
On hit will severely decrease speed and manoeuvrability of S and M ships, also affects L and XL ships.
Will stop in place almost any type of target.
Will slowdown any target, effect on large ships is weaker.
Will slowdown S and M ships, has no effect on larger ships.
Will slowdown S, has no effect on larger ships.
On explosion will attach Buzz Droids to any nearby ship, dealing hull damage and impacting ship manoeuvrability.
When targeting enemies will create a bubble of gravity anomaly stopping all affected ships from using travel drive.
The P-12 is a starfighter-scale shield generator manufactured by Sirplex. It is the second weakest shield generator of its class but also one of the most popular, and it regenerates the fastest.
Shield generator manufactured by Novaldex for advanced TIE models and other light starfighters.

Starfighter-scale shield generator manufactured by the Corellian Engineering Corporation.

Starfighter-scale shield generator produced by Sienar Fleet Systems. As the Empire began to fracture after the Battle of Endor, SFS decided to begin production of basic shield generators for the TIE/LN, TIE/sa and TIE/IN to improve their survivability. After moving to a wider market, many other old fighters, previously unshielded, were retrofitted to mount this type of shield generator.

A model of astromech manufactured by Industrial Automation and heavily used by the Corporate Sector Authority. Provides a 50% boost to shield strength and regeneration.
A model of astromech manufactured by Industrial Automation. Provides a 40% boost to shield strength and regeneration.
A model of astromech manufactured by Industrial Automation. Provides a 30% boost to shield strength and regeneration.
A model of astromech manufactured by Industrial Automation and heavily used by the Alliance to Restore the Republic. Provides a 40% boost to shield strength and regeneration speed.

A droid manufactured by LesTech in an attempt to take advantage of the lucrative astromech market. It is notable for having a boxy chassis and using a single, wide tread track. Provides only a marginal boost to shield strength, but a 70% boost to regeneration speed.

The ISD-72x is a local-area deflector shield generator and sensor array produced by Kuat Drive Yards and is commonly installed on Imperial I-class Star Destroyers.

The ISD-73x is a local-area deflector shield generator and sensor array produced by Kuat Drive Yards and is commonly installed on Imperial II-class Star Destroyers. More powerful than the ISD-72x, it also has stronger armour plating, giving it considerably more protection against snubfighter attacks.

Thermal shields are heavily reinforced deflector shields that has very high capacity but lower regeneration speed. The DEC-78 is a thermal shield generator manufactured by the Dac Engineering Corporation, a Dac-based manufacturing corporation run by former Quarren separatists.

The ISD-54x is a local-area shield generator and sensor array produced by Kuat Drive Yards. It is a downscaled version of the ISD-72x, meant to be installed on smaller Star Destroyers such as the Victory- and Procursator-class.
A shield generator component produced by Quintad Orbital Manufacturing that reinforces a starship's shields.

GNK power droids are effectively mobile power generators, with simple artificial intelligence for understanding basic commands. Due to their relatively high power output, they are capable of providing more power to a starship's shields.
The PSD-70x is a local-area deflector shield generator and sensor array produced by Kuat Drive Yards and is commonly installed on Procursator-class Star Destroyers.
Shield specifically designed for installation on largest of Mon Calamari dreadnaughts.
Shield specifically designed for installation on largest of Mon Calamari dreadnaughts.
This massive shield generator was originally designed by Kuat Drive Yards for use on their space stations.
Rendili StarDrive designed this extremely large shield generator to protect external elements on space stations.
An even smaller frigate-scale shield generator manufactured by Kuat Drive Yards. Often found installed on large Imperial transports, frigates and logistics vessels.
SFS P-s4 Twin Ion Engine with Hyperdrive
The SFS P-s4 twin ion engine is an ion drive system manufactured by Sienar Fleet Systems and most notably used on TIE-series starfighters.
This is a modification with a hyperdrive. The SFS P-s4 twin ion engine was an ion drive system manufactured by Sienar Fleet Systems and most notably used aboard the TIE-line starfighters.
The Ter58 ion turbine engine was a type of ion drive manufactured by Girodyne. The Corellian Engineering Corporation had them installed in their CR90 corvettes.
The SRB42 sublight engine was a sublight ion drive manufactured by Girodyne. It notably equipped the YT-1300 light freighter in a long strip known as a "wide bar engine".
The J-77 "Event Horizon" engine was a small yet powerful sublight drive unit that was manufactured by Novaldex, and used in the Rebel Alliance's RZ-1 A-wing interceptor.
The 2a fission engine or 2a Ion fission engine is manufactured by Incom Corporation and used by a wide variety of governments and private customers.
4L4 fusial thrust engines are advanced sublight drive engines manufactured by Incom Corporation for use aboard X-wing starfighters.
4L5 fusial thrust engines are advanced sublight drive engines manufactured by Incom Corporation for use aboard new models of X-wing starfighters.
The R200 ion jet engine, also known as R200 ion fission engine, was an ion engine produced by Koensayr Manufacturing, and was installed aboard their BTL-A4 Y-wing assault starfighter/bomber.
The Destroyer-I ion engine is a model of ion engine manufactured by Kuat Drive Yards for use in the Imperial-class Star Destroyers in service of the Galactic Empire.
The Venator-I ion engine is a model of ion engine manufactured by Kuat Drive Yards for use in the Venator-class Star Destroyers.
SFS-204 sublight ion engines are a type of ion drive made by Sienar Fleet Systems. They can be found on Lambda-class T-4a shuttles.
The 4a fission engine is a heavier version of 2a engine, designed for medium-sized fighters and landing craft.
Engine for the Storm Commando Carrier.
Engine for the Jehavey'ir-type Assault Ship

The Hapans are a secretive, matriarchal society from the Hapes Cluster, a star systems region hidden behind dense nebulae. Renowned for their striking beauty, advanced technology, and political intrigue, they value isolationism and pride but often clash with the galaxy's broader powers.

The Mandalorians are a warrior culture from the Outer Rim, known for their highly advanced armour, unyielding combat skills, and a code centered around honour and survival. Though their society has fractured over time, Mandalorian traditions and their iconic beskar armour remain symbols of resilience and strength.

The Sith are a faction rooted in the pursuit of power and domination, guided by the philosophy of the Dark Side of the Force. They are known for their mastery of manipulation, advanced technology, and the construction of vast empires built on fear and control. Once almost eradicated, now rising to power again.

The Galactic Empire, also known as the New Order, or simply the Empire, was the galactic government that replaced the Galactic Republic in the aftermath of the Clone Wars. The Empire ushered galactic civilisation into a new age of safety, freedom, justice, and security, but this was achieved through absolute tyranny. Shortly before the Battle of Yavin, less than twenty years after its founding, the Empire had its legislative body, the Galactic Senate, dissolved, effectively becoming a military dictatorship. It is currently the largest political, territorial, and military power to date, with access to nearly unlimited funding and holding sway over a large majority of the galaxy. However, following the death of its Emperor, Sheev Palpatine, during the disastrous Battle of Endor, the Empire has entered a period of steady decline over the past few years, with some political or military groups within the Empire breaking away entirely, either to continue the Imperial dream on their own terms or to form new dominions. Those still loyal to the Imperial leadership are known by Alliance intelligence officers as simply Imperial Loyalists. As of 4 ABY, the Empire is lead by a Grand Vizier, originally a title held by the Emperor's personal assistant. The current Grand Vizier is Sate Pestage.

The Bounty Hunters' Guild, also known as the Bondsman's Guild, or simply the Bounty Guild, is an institution that regulates the complicated profession that is the bounty-hunting trade throughout the galaxy. Ensuring the legality of hunting for its members, it works alongside galactic governments and curates bounties for its members. Although it is smaller than it once was following a violent period of internal strife ignited by Boba Fett in 1 ABY, the Guild is still active today.
Bounty Hunters' Guild Unique Ship Access
Bounty Hunters' Guild Unique Equipment Access

The New Republic is the galactic government established by the Alliance to Restore the Republic to replace the Galactic Empire after the Battle of Endor. Like its predecessor, it was often simply referred to as the Republic. It has become the supreme governmental authority of the galaxy. The "New" Republic is a continuation of the original Galactic Republic that had become known as the Old Republic. While the New Republic is busy establishing security around the galaxy, its adversaries are not yet done with the fight.
Remnants of the Alliance to Restore the Republic, fulfilling mostly police roles and some special operations.

Following the death of the Emperor at Endor, Imperial leadership fragmented into various warlords and renegade admirals, generals, and Moffs. Though many have given their loyalty to Grand Vizier Sate Pestage, leading the Imperial Remnant in the galactic north, others have formed a new government in the galactic south: the Imperial Ascendancy. Eschewing certain Imperial traditions, the Ascendancy has replaced some ships with less popular designs, and uses the Anoat Federation, a vassal state of pirates, mercenaries, and smugglers, to harass the New Republic.\nAs a consequence of Imperial ideology, the Ascendancy despises its rival in the north.

The Corporate Sector Authority, commonly abbreviated to CSA, is a corporate authority that controlled the Corporate Sector, which is located in the galaxy's Outer Rim Territories. All economic, political and judicial systems are controlled by member corporations or corporate interest, who are chartered to directly administer the sector.

A tight alliance, formed out of remnant members of infamous Confederacy of Independent Systems, that saw its rebirth as the Independent Commerce Guild after the fall of the Empire. Now interested mainly in fighting for influence in Outer Rim regions.

The Hutt Cartel, also known as the Hutt Clan, Hutt Syndicate, Hutt Crime Syndicate, Hutt Cartels or Hutt Clans, is a powerful Hutt criminal family in the Outer Rim Territories of the galaxy, making riches through smuggling and myriad illegal businesses across worlds. Aside from its criminal activity, the Hutt Cartel rules over swathes of territories known as Hutt Space.

The Death Watch, or Kyr'tsad in Mando'a, is a Mandalorian splinter group who opposed Jaster Mereel's Supercommando Codex. Their primary goal is to return the Mandalorians to their ancient roots as galactic crusaders, and advocate the savage raider mentality of past Mandalorians.

Once a small mining corporation based in Anoat system, the Anoat Federation is a growing power thanks to Imperial Ascendancy investments. These investments began as a means to use the Federation as a proxy for activities the Imperial Ascendancy found unsavoury, such as criminal and smuggling operations. They have since grown to include legitimate business and logistics operations within Anoat space, all to serve Ascendancy goals. It is safe to call Anoat Federation a vassal of the Imperial Ascendancy, which causes significant friction with the New Republic.
These pirates serve as the... less legitimate enforcers of Hutt rule.

The Black Sun is among the most powerful and infamous crime syndicates in the galaxy. It wields significant influence in various galactic governments and is heavily involved in piracy and smuggling.\nFormed at the end of the Great Galactic War, more than three thousand years before the rise of the Galactic Empire, the Black Sun quickly rose to prominence by seizing control of neighbourhoods in the lower levels of Coruscant. Throughout the next few years, the organisation spread beyond the planet and became a galactic criminal syndicate.\nIn addition to its activities in "regular" organised crime, the Black Sun's true reach included an intelligence network that rivalled even that of the Galactic Empire, and the syndicate even employed its own private army and assassins.

The Valarian Syndicate is a criminal organisation created by the Whipid crime lord known as Lady Valarian. Its goal is to become as powerful as the Hutt Cartel, due to its leader's intense rivalry with the late crime lord Jabba.\nThe Valarian Syndicate employed a variety of smugglers, pilots, thugs, and assassins, as well as contracting the occasional independent spacer to conduct sensitive operations.
These Mandalorian raiders are even more aggressive than the Death Watch.

The Hapes Consortium is a matriarchal monarchy of the near-Human Hapans in the Hapes Cluster, a closely packed star cluster located in the Inner Rim of the galaxy. Politically a consortium, it was based on Hapes and spanned few closely positioned star systems, each with at least one habited world and had existed since before 3000 BBY after the Lorell Raiders were wiped out by the Galactic Republic and Jedi Order. The Hapes Consortium is one of the galaxy's few insular civilizations, and had undergone a long period of isolation. Members of Hapes Consortium are known to go on pirate raides, which is categorically denied by its government.
A renewed government that was granted autonomy after the fall of the Empire.

Kuat Drive Yards is among the oldest and largest military shipbuilding corporations in the galaxy. Based in orbital yards around the planet Kuat, the company and its subsidiaries have manufactured everything from swoop bikes to the mighty Imperial-class Star Destroyer. \n Formed by a union of aristocrats known as the Ten, Kuat Drive Yards has faced significant opposition over its long history. From internal strife during the construction of the shipyards, to competition with larger corporations like Core Galaxy Systems and Hoersch-Kessel Drive, Inc, KDY initially struggled to survive in a harsh and competitive environment. It has earned a reputation as a predatory company, buying up smaller shipbuilders and operating outside the Kuat sector to earn its place. \n In the Clone Wars, Kuat sold vehicles and vessels to the Republic, including the mighty Venator-class Star Destroyer. During the Imperial Era, Kuat manufactured the Imperial-class Star Destroyers and the All-Terrain series of walkers.

The Corellian Engineering Corporation is one of the largest starship manufacturers in the galaxy, and is widely considered the most prolific. It owes much of its success to an abnormally high number of skilled designers, engineers, and shipwrights, many of whom were taught in the Corellia system. \n One of the oldest starship manufacturers in the galaxy, the Corellian Engineering Corporation ALSO claims to be the longest operating business entity in galactic history. \n The shipyards are well known for a variety of ship models, ranging from the prolific YT-series light freighters to the CR-90 corvette and beyond. Aside from its ships, CEC also builds various starship components.

Sienar Fleet Systems is a major starship manufacturer, famed for its fearsome TIE line of starfighters. Since the formation of the Galactic Empire, Sienar provided the Imperial navy with a variety of weapons, starfighters, transports, and even capital ships.

Hoersch-Kessel Drive, Inc. is one of the most successful starship corporations in the galaxy. At one time a subsidiary of the Trade Federation, it later produced starships for the Confederacy of Independent Systems, including the Munificent-class Frigate and the Recusant-class Destroyer.

Rendili StarDrive is among the oldest starship manufacturers in the galaxy. Dating back to the founding of the Galactic Republic, Rendili is synonymous with starship construction, and prides itself on efficiency and reliability over cutting-edge innovation. RSD's ships served as the backbone of the Republic's navy and planetary defence fleets for millennia, including famed (and infamous) designs such as the Dreadnought-class Heavy Cruiser. \n In the final centuries of the Galactic Republic, Rendili's prominence waned as its rival, Kuat Drive Yards, gained influence.

The Incom Corporation is a starship manufacturer known for designing starfighters, speeders, and transports. \n Originally in the business of high-performance repulsorlift platforms such as Cloud City, Incom switched to specialisation in atmospheric and space fightercraft in the final centuries of the Republic. During those days, the company designed popular fighters like the Z-95 Headhunter, the ARC-170 starfighter, and the famous T-65 X-wing. \n This corporation will not change alignment when captured!

TransGalMeg Industries, Incorporated is a diversified corporation best known for its starship designs. It produces a number of transport vessels, as well as starfighters and hyperspace transport rings. During the Imperial Era, TransGalMeg aligned itself with the Galactic Empire, though it also sold ships to both the Black Sun and the Rebel Alliance.

Mon Calamari Shipyards is a shipwright company that produces numerous models of transports and warships. Operating out of the orbital shipyards of Mon Calamari, MCS is renowned for its elegant, organic-looking hulls. 
 Formed more than four thousand years before the formation of the Galactic Empire, Mon Calamari Shipyards was a collaborative effort between the two native species of Mon Calamari: The Mon Calamari and the Quarren. Dreaming of what lay beyond their oceanic world, the company developed several orbital facilities to construct starliners and specialised exploration vessels. 
 After the formation of the Galactic Empire, the company and its home planet were subjugated and enslaved, though the Imperials never managed to adapt Mon Calamari technology to Imperial standards. Mon Calamari Shipyards were still able to develop luxury starliners, however, and the company took advantage of this to secretly produce prototypes for warships. Eventually, Mon Calamari overthrew Imperial occupation and used its orbital shipyards to retrofit its luxury liners into the infamous MC-series of star cruisers.

This corporation will not change alignment when captured!
The Twin Suns Transport Service is a small shipping company. They employ a wide variety of freighters.

The Baobab Merchant Fleet is a trading fleet organised many years before the rise of the Galactic Empire. One of the fleet's claims to fame is the development of the Bocce trade language, used to allow communication between starship pilots, crews, and support personnel.

The Tagge Corporation, or TaggeCo, is a megacorporation owned by the House of Tagge. Originally intended as a sham corporation for Tarzen Tagge to smuggle goods to new markets, it legitimised its own business in order to avoid investigations by government officials. Now, it owns hundreds of subsidiaries across a wide variety of industries, from mining and refining, to speeders and transports, to restaurants.
This Wharf Facility is equipped to produce a wide range of starfighters and medium ships to support Imperial expansion efforts.
This Equipment Facility is made to modify and supply a wide range of starfighters and medium ships to support Imperial expansion efforts.
This Equipment Facility is the largest of its kind.
Free Port S and M Docks
Imperial Trade Station Dock M and S
This ring pier, one of the largest of its kind, is used as the core of any Imperial trade station.
Station used by Bounty Hunters guild to support their activity.
Imperial Throne Room Tower is generally used as an observation tower.
Supercapital construction facility allows construction of XXL dreadnaught-class warships.
This is a pier for the largest ships in the galaxy. It can also be used to resupply those ships.

Attention Citizen! \(READ CAREFULLY!\)
We at the Galactic Immigration Agency want to help everyone to find their place in this vast universe. To help you and others like you, we gathered information from governments across the galaxy on the requirements for gaining citizenship and additional benefits and listed them below for your reference. 
You can always contact any station manager's office on any faction station to check on your citizenship documentation. 

What do these requirements mean?
Production Stations - stations with at least one production module and dock in government space.
Station Transactions - transactions from your stations and their subordinates in that government's space, to that government.
Frontier Defence Stations - station with an administration/claim module in a government sector bordering either a contested, unclaimed, or enemy sector.

 Please refer to the pamphlet that was sent in a separate message for a more detailed requirements list for citizenship by various governments.
Galactic Immigration Agency: List of requirements

Hey, we found some information on you, seems you may be interested in some money. 

If you are ready to get your hands dirty for that, come see us. Our Guild operates in all major government jurisdictions, but main office is in Milagro system. 

We do offer variety of targets and unique ships for your needs, if you buy that license that is.
YOU RECEIVED AN IMPORTANT MESSAGE, READ IT!!!

Attention Citizen!

By galactic law and common sense you will now have to pay more attention to your ships as they require regular maintenance. There are a few ways to make your life easier, so pay attention! 
 NOTE: The Maintenance menu can be accessed through the player info menu-- look for a wrench icon!

HOW THE MAINTENANCE SYSTEM WORKS
1. The maintenance cycle occurs every 30 minutes, and the Maintenance menu will display the time until the next cycle.
2. The SHIP SUPPLIES ware can be bought from other factions, or produced yourself with a Ship Supplies Module, and stored at your Equipment Docks to be consumed.
3.Each ship has a SUPPLY COST. The more powerful your faction is, the higher that cost. Initially, you will barely notice it, but with further development of your organisation this may change.
NOTE: The SUPPLY COST of a specific ship can be seen in its encyclopedia entry.
4.Each sector you own has a SUPPLY LEVEL which negates the SUPPLY COST of your ships. 
5.You can build Equipment Docks in your owned sectors to increase the SUPPLY LEVEL of that sector up to 3 times! Each size of maintenance module, S/M, L, and XL, adds 1 to that multiplier. Multiple modules of the same size are NOT cumulative, so one of each per sector is enough.
NOTE: Only one EQ dock per sector is considered, and it should not have shipbuilding functionality-- SUCH STATIONS WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED! Equipment Docks may have ware production and Administration modules, so you can combine your Ship Module production and your maintenance docks, or your defence stations and maintenance docks, or both!
6. L/XL ships docked at player-owned EQ Docks will receive a 25% cut in their Supply Cost, regardless of if that EQ Dock is in a player-owned sector.
7. S/M ships docked at player-owned Carriers and Auxiliary ships will receive a 25% cut in their supply cost, regardless of where the Carrier is.
8. If the sum of SUPPLY LEVEL from your owned sectors and EQ docks is still not enough to cover your ships cumulative SUPPLY COST, then SHIP SUPPLIES wares will be consumed randomly from all of your EQ docks across the galaxy, usually 2 wares per 1 non-covered SUPPLY COST.
NOTE: SHIP SUPPLIES can be consumed from any of your Equipment Docks, though only EQ docks in your owned sectors will increase your SUPPLY LEVEL.
9.If consuming SUPPLY WARES is still not enough to cover all SUPPLY COST of your ships, then you will pay in money, usually 5000 Credits per 1 non-covered SUPPLY COST. 

Failing to pay the maintenance of your ships, which includes wages to your hired crewmen, will lead to morale loss among them.

The station seems to be decommissioned now, or abandoned for some reason, I have no clue.

Anyway, as your actions seems to have lift off the quarantine I want to thank you in some way.
This station was experimental facility to test large objects hyperjump possibility, so I can initiate the sequence for you, the drive system proved to be very unstable however, so will most probably become inoperable after first jump. That was the main reason for project cancellation, though Iâ€™m wondering why they left all that research equipment here.

After the jump I will leave the station, you are free to do whatever you want with it.

In recent days the New Republic Senate voted to restrict Anoat Federation business opportunities and access to galactic banks accounts due to its violation of the Bespin Treaty.\n\nFederation representatives refused to adhere to the requirements from the New Republic, and announced that they will protect their rights to territory and business with arms, if needed.

According to latest reports, the New Republic Senate is gathering to discuss the possible violation of the Bespin Treaty signed between the New Republic and the Anoat Federation. 
The Senate states that the Anoat Federation is allowed to operate in Outer Rim territories only while keeping to agreed territory claims when the treaty at Bespin was signed by the two parties.
Lately, Anoat Federation has been accused numerous times by New Republic representatives of working with the Imperial Ascendancy and various pirate groups, supplying them with ships and weapons.
The Anoat Federation may see further deterioration of relations with the New Republic if its expansion continues.

In a bold move signalling the start of a new arms race, various factions across the galaxy have commenced the construction of new Super Star Destroyers and Dreadnaughts. This escalation follows a recent surge in interstellar tensions, with rivalries heating up between the New Republic, Ascendancy, remnants of the Galactic Empire and other emerging powers. .\n\nThe arms race has sparked concerns among neutral systems and smaller factions, fearing they might be caught in the crossfire between galactic superpowers. Diplomatic efforts are underway, but the galaxy watches with bated breath as the race for military dominance accelerates. As construction continues, the balance of power in the galaxy hangs in the balance, with the potential for significant repercussions in the years to come.
Medal of Kamino granted to brave souls who helped Kamino to gain independence.
Help Kamino to take over Manda system.

Help Kamino to take over Manda system. In this way they can start their expansion, and with proper support can join the Corporate Sector Authority in their fight against the Independent Commerce Guild.
Kamino has gained control over new sector, tensions with ICG are rising
Kamino Planetary Authority has just announced that they are now joining into the fight against the oppressive ICG regime, joining CSA in their fight.
Lightsaber of the Emperor Sheev Palpatine.
Helmet of the Sith Lord Vader.

The Darksaber is an ancient and unique black-bladed lightsaber created by Tarre Vizsla, the first Mandalorian ever inducted into the Jedi Order, around 1050 BBY. The wielder of the saber is considered to be the master of Mandalore.
Prove that you are a worthy successor to Emperor Palpatine. Take his seat over the Coruscant, and cripple the New Republic.
Prove that you are the only true Emperor; valuable item
You now proved your worth. Those who disagree need to learn their place.
Mandalorians will not be of concern anymore; valuable item
Mandalore proved to be an annoyance, destroy their will to fight, take the Mandalore.
has taken control of the Coruscant and was promoted as a new Emperor!\nOther factions in the galaxy are now in discussion of ceasefire in the face of a new threat rising.
Mandalore government just announced about peace treaty with the remnants of NRL. Together they will face the new threat,
It is reported that different governments across the galaxy are uniting their efforts in the face of a a threat from

.\nWe can expect them to officially declare war on that new threat, as they will obviously will be next targets.\nAll governments will review their relations one to another to stand together as united front.

The Alliance Medal of Honor is a Rebel Alliance military decoration awarded to those who performed above and beyond the call of duty while serving in, or with, the Alliance Military. The award is a silver badge emblazoned with the red phoenix of the Alliance beneath an etching of an X-wing starfighter.
In the wrong place at the wrong time

Coordinates provided by the agent seems to be a trap, and it seems that he stands behind the disinformation campaign targeting you personally. We will deal with that agent later, for now I need to survive the Black Sun ambush and get back to the Alliance HQ. Returning the Liability of Guardian in working condition will certainly please HQ.
Increased operations budget if capital ship survives.
Dock Liability of Guardian to Alliance HQ

Alliance HQ wants you to hunt down the traitor agent that sent you and your men into an enemy trap. The agent is aware that you survived the ambush, and traded some secrets for his protection and a bounty on your head, be careful.
Deal a crippling blow to the Bastion system
Deal a crippling blow to the Eriadu system

Thank you for bringing the Liability of Guardian back to us. After briefing with the command, General Organa proposed the idea to leave it in your possession, and HQ agreed, it will be repaired and refurbished. Additionally, you will be provided with extra credits to support your future operations.

Welcome back to HQ. Its unfortunate that you failed to bring back Liability of Guardian. We are currently limited in our resources, so no additional ship will be provided for your operation. We will however provide some credits.

Welcome back to HQ. We are aware about the incident during the operation, we hope this sum will cover some of the costs. Please dock the Liability of Guardian for repairs to Alliance HQ and wait for further instructions.

Your mission is to capture and deliver specified ships to Mandalore, ensuring the continued strength and prosperity of our clan. As an outcast, this is your opportunity to prove your loyalty and worth to our Mandalorian way.
The Super Capital Construction project allows for the construction of a special XXL construction facility, capable of building and docking the largest warships.
Allows construction of the Executor-class Super Star Destroyer.
Allows construction of the Bellator-class Dreadnaught.
Allows construction of an SSD Prototype.
Allows construction of a prototype for a new TIE design.
Allows construction of a Subjugator-class Battlecruiser.
Allows construction of the MC80 Home One Star Cruiser.
Allows construction of the MC85 Star Cruiser.

INITIAL DIFFICULTY: Moderate\n\nYou have not yet been formally accepted into the Alliance's armed forces due to various reasons, but you decided to join the fight anyway. Some old friends helped you to join the Security training program and now, after graduation, you have the right to own a starfighter to perform security duties. With your trusty E-wing, prove to Republic that you are a worthy pilot.

You have not yet been formally accepted into the Alliance's armed forces due to various reasons, but you decided to join the fight anyway. Some old friends helped you to join the Security training program and now, after graduation, you have the right to own a starfighter to perform security duties. With your trusty E-wing, prove to Republic that you are a worthy pilot.

INITIAL DIFFICULTY: Moderate\n\nWhile the Galactic Civil War is far from over, there is still much money to be made from the conflict. Put your reliable freighter and your funds to good use, the Republic needs the support of every citizen.

While the Galactic Civil War is far from over, there is still much money to be made from the conflict. Put your reliable freighter and your funds to good use, the Republic needs the support of every citizen.

INITIAL DIFFICULTY: Hard\n\nAfter graduating from the Imperial Navy Academy with exceptional grades, you were given a choice to join the Navy as a regular starfighter pilot or become a free agent and bring order to the galaxy in other, different ways, that may not be directly associated with the Empire.

After graduating from the Imperial Navy Academy with exceptional grades, you were given a choice to join the Navy as a regular starfighter pilot or become a free agent and bring order to the galaxy in other, different ways, that may not be directly associated with the Empire.

INITIAL DIFFICULTY: Moderate\n\nBattles fought on the front lines can change the course of a war, but so can logistics. Your family business is strongly associated with the Sienar corporation, but you decided to branch away and help Empire with your own vision.

Battles fought on the front lines can change the course of a war, but so can logistics. Your family business is strongly associated with the Sienar corporation, but you decided to branch away and help Empire with your own vision.

INITIAL DIFFICULTY: Easy\n\nAfter a long tour of duty within the CSA and taking part in numerous border skirmishes with the Independent Commerce Guild, you were finally able to retire. As with all officers serving the CSA, you had the right to keep your starship. Unfortunately, having spent most of your life serving, you don't have a real home to return to.

As with all officers serving the CSA, you had the right to keep your starship. Unfortunately, having spent most of your life serving, you don't have a real home to return to.

INITIAL DIFFICULTY: Hard\n\nLong ago your clan dishonoured itself by siding with certain Imperial elements. Being an outcast is not the way. Finding a way to join the forces as a mere mercenary you focus on bringing back the glory and honour of your clan among Mandalorian society.

*Up-to-date equipment and pirate insurance sold separately.

INITIAL DIFFICULTY: Moderate\n\nServing your time in the Kessel mines, you soon understood that to survive you need to "cooperate". Serving as a good informant to the authorities you were able cut your sentence short and even retained some of your confiscated family funds. Due to your actions, however, you made some enemies in Hutt Cartel.

You could prove to New Republic authorities that your dealings with the Empire were exclusively of commercial interest, that helped you to retain at least freedom and some personal funds and assets.

You could prove to New Republic authorities that your dealings with the Empire were exclusively of commercial interest, which helped you to retain at least freedom and some personal funds and assets.

INITIAL DIFFICULTY: Advanced\n\nEven the most radical Mandalorian leaders consider your clan to be a vile tribe. You are hunted by most factions in the galaxy, your numbers are dwindling and assets are hard to come by. But this time luck is on your side, you laid a perfect ambush with fake distress call and managed to board your prize ship. This is the way.
Your marines already boarded the ship, wait for them to complete the take over
Takeover complete, ship is ours. This is the way.

In the aftermath of the Battle of Endor you ordered your loyal crew to hide and wait. Now, when the galaxy is in chaos, is the best time to rise and rebuild the First Galactic Empire.

INITIAL DIFFICULTY: Advanced
*Most Factions except NRL are NOT welcoming.*
You and your wingmates were dispatched on a secret mission by New Republic to uncover Anoat Republic schemes to supply the Imperial Ascendancy with weapons and equipment. After a recent strangely coordinated ambush of Black Sun pirates, news started to come in stating that you and your group were identified as pirate supporters, and a bounty on your head was published. All members of your group were proclaimed as dangerous pirates and most factions will most probably shoot you on sight. Knowing the nature of this secret mission, the only way out is to find a route back to NRL space without dying. Currently, you are being chased by a group of pirate ships.
Liability of Guardian with fighter wing

INITIAL DIFFICULTY: Advanced
*Everyone hates you except CSA.*
You are one of the failed Kamino experiments, a clone with changes to your DNA different from the regular batch, slowing your ageing instead, created to test different approaches to the cloning process. While still receiving good training and care in Tipoca City you always felt like just another cog in the system and you wanted more. Luckily, you managed to get off the planet during the raid of the CIS forces on Kamino. Going as far as possible to the Outer Rim you started to work as a Mercenary. It was far from easy after the Clone Wars ended, due to having an appearance similar to other clones you were considered to be faithful to the Empire and were not welcomed on many planets. Though, with good combat tactics knowledge and education as well as through good service you ended up as a high-ranking mercenary captain in the CSA, commanding a specially equipped Venator-class Star Destroyer. The last contract you received was to patrol backwater space after reports of ICG ships sighted in the area.

With the leader gone, what remained of the band is now yours.

Spending nights in your family's estate planning her escape, determined to leave the life of privilege behind. Though still at home, your heart and mind were already soaring through the stars, ready to embrace the thrill of adventure and experience the hard life of the galaxy.

INITIAL DIFFICULTY: Advanced\n*Everyone hates you except Sith.*\nYou are being sent beyond the veil to see if the time has come for Sith return.
You are being sent beyond the veil to see if the time has come for Sith to return.
This facility refines and compresses rhydonium to be used in further production.

Crystallized rhydonium can be rarely found on surface of asteroids, and is often used in ship power systems. Volatile and highly explosive, it is dangerous to salvage and its fumes are harmful to organic health.
Supplies used to support ships and their crews during long-term deployments.
Rhydonium Cores are used during construction of capital ships to feed their power-hungry reactors.

Tibanna is a rare form of matter found in both gas and liquid form. In its natural state as a gas, tibanna comprised the atmospheres of several planets and can be found in nebulas. It is used in hyperdrives and starship weaponry, and as a coolant around the gravito-active elements of repulsorlifts, which makes it a valuable resource.
After refining, Tibanna is transported in sealed containers or cells that are used in further productions.

Durasteel is an incredibly strong and versatile metal alloy, created from carvanium, lommite, carbon, meleenium, neutronium, and zersium. It is capable of withstanding blistering heat, frigid cold, and monumental physical stress, even when very thin. Because of these properties, durasteel is used for everything from smelting pots for other less hearty metals to spacecraft hulls.
Variety of plants from different planets.

Contraband Alcohol, fire-water or booze, referred to a number of beverages that contained ethanol and octane, and had mind-altering effects on many organic species while in the bloodstream. It increases the the interest of people to stay at the station.

Sensors have seen elegant redesign over the years so that ships and stations do not risk fragile antennas being broken or destroyed by collisions. Now entirely internal systems, sensors are used not just in ship and station scanners and radars, but are also used in the targeting systems supplied with turret and droid components.
Various parts of droids from different manufacturers, you can build almost any astromech or assassin droid from them!
High-energy capacitors used in different high tech mechanisms to transfer energy between various parts.

An originally greenish-black composite metal with extreme tensile strength, fibersteel can change colour dramatically based on how much stress is applied to it during forging process. Used in starship construction by the Sith.
Power cells that use extremely condensed Tibanna, used in Sith technology.
A high-performance composite material that can be used in both electronics and alloy production. However, the manufacturing process is used almost exclusively by the Sith.
A gelatinous healing mixture used throughout the universe for medicine, as well as in cloning processes.
Used in a cloning process by the Sith to produce an obedient workforce and crew for their ships.

Abregado-Rae is a planet in the Core Worlds. Located at the beginning of the Rimma Trade Route, it is a prosperous trade and manufacturing world, but was still considered as backwards as an Outer Rim planet: Beyond the relative safety of the spaceports, Abregado-rae is a wilderness. Discovered ten millennia before the rise of the Galactic Empire, Abregado was not colonised for thousands of years more. During the Jedi Civil War, it joined Darth Revan's Sith Empire, and during the Clone Wars Abregado remained part of the Republic.

Adarlon is a planet in the Outer Rim, along the Rimma Trade Route. Originally colonised by Alderaanians for its beauty, more than its natural resources, it developed a culture focused on entertainment instead of survival. It is one of the galaxy's most prominent centres of tourism and the entertainment industry.

Agamar is a terrestrial planet in the Outer Rim. Once a part of the Rakatan Infinite Empire, it remained somewhat independent of the later Galactic Republic and Sith Empires until after the Great Galactic war, more than three thousand years before the rise of the Galactic Empire. Agamar joined that Empire following the end of the Clone Wars, though full control was never achieved, and resistance to Imperial rule strengthened over time.

Ahch-To, known by many names in ancient legends, is a planet mostly covered in water, with numerous rocky islands blanketed with green trees located in the Unknown Regions. It was the birthplace of the Jedi Order and held the ancient Jedi texts.
Ajan Kloss is a jungle moon located in the Cademimu sector of the Outer Rim Territories, in grid square L-5 on the Standard Galactic Grid, orbiting the gas giant Ajara.
Once a planet of great wealth and influence, now its a monument to horrendous atrocities of the Empire.

The Andalia system is located in the Lorelli Reach, an area of the Hapes Cluster in the Slice portion of the Inner Rim. It is connected by the hyperlane known as the Lorell Route to the Lorell and Sennex systems.

Annaj is a fog-covered planet in the Outer Rim. First discovered three hundred years before the rise of the Galactic Empire, it is the first stop for most ships into it remote region of the galaxy. It served as a staging area for the Imperial Navy during the construction of the second Death Star, and Imperial forces retreated here after its destruction.
Anoat is one of three habitable planets in the Anoat system of the Anoat sector, located in the Greater Javin of the Outer Rim. It is located between the Hoth system and the Bespin system.
Ansion is a planet in the Mid Rim near Vortex and Bilbringi, located on the Namadii Corridor.
Arkanis is the sector capital of the Arkanis sector. It is inhabited by Humans such as Devon Fuller. It was the throneworld of the Arkanis Regency, which included the ancient Empress Teeda.

Ast Kikorie, also called "Down Below", is a planet in Moddell sector. It was a Galactic Republic astrocartographic research outpost with a ring of orbiting telescopes connected to Kikorie City by a skyhook. The planet was abandoned by the Republic at the onset of the Clone Wars in 22 BBY.

Atrisia, also known as Kitel Phard, is a terrestrial planet located in the Core Worlds sector known as the Atrisian Commonwealth. It lay on the Giju Run hyperlane and is the homeworld of the creature known as the shredder bat.
Bakura is a planet located in the galaxy's Wild Space. It is connected to the planet Endor by a hyperspace route.

Balmorra is a factory world that is located within the Balmorra system, situated in a strategic position between the Colonies and the border of the Core Worlds. Due to its intense industrial manufacturing it is known as one of the most important foundry worlds in the Republic's space, where some of the most advanced weaponry and battle droids were constantly produced throughout most of the planet's history.

Bandomeer is a planet in the Outer Rim Territories, on the Braxant Run. It is known for its high concentration of ionite, as well as the many predators lurking in its wildernesses. The planet's surface is roughly divided in half by a huge landmass and the Great Sea of Bandomeer.
Bastion is an industrialised planet located in the Outer Rim Territories of the galaxy. Also part of the New Territories, it is connected via hyperspace route to Anthan Prime.
Bellassa is an astronomical object located in the galaxy's Core Worlds. It is connected via the Hydian Way hyperspace route to Skako and Fedalle.
Bescane is a planet near Dantooine, run by Galentro Heavy Works. A cool, temperate world, it is overpopulated and covered in factories, its natural environment destroyed.

Bespin is a gas giant in the Bespin system of the Anoat sector on the Ison Corridor in the Greater Javin region of the Outer Rim Territories. It is also a major source of tibanna gas, which is refined for production and transport in numerous mining operations including Cloud City and Tibannopolis.

Bilbringi is a world located in the galaxy's Inner Rim. It is home to the Bilbringi shipyards, a facility which dismantled the Separatist dreadnaught Lucid Voice within a year after the end of the Clone Wars.

Bogden is a planet located in the galaxy's Inner Rim on the Hydian Way that is orbited by multiple moons, one of which was the location where the Sith Lord Darth Tyranus secretly hired the bounty hunter Jango Fett to become the cloning template for the future Grand Army of the Republic.
Boonta, formerly known as Ko Vari, is a planet that had been colonised by the Hutts long ago. Despite it being a devastated world, Boonta is famous in the galaxy for its podracing and speeder races.

Bothawui is a planet in the Mid Rim. A temperate, mountainous world, Bothawui is a major trade hub, as well as home to the Bothan people. Though it was an early member of the Republic and a longstanding and influential member of the Senate, the planet maintained neutrality during the Clone Wars. It carried this neutrality into the Imperial era, maintaining some limited autonomy from the Empire, but different Bothan clans supported either the Empire or the Rebellion, and some Rebel-aligned clans aided in the retrieval of the plans for the second Death Star.
Brentaal IV, also referred to simply as Brentaal, is a terrestrial planet located in the galaxy's Core Worlds, on both the Hydian Way and the Perlemian Trade Route.

Byss is a planet located within the galaxy's Deep Core with a Standard Galactic Grid coordinate of K-11. Only discovered late during the Old Republic, it is the endpoint of the Byss Run hyperspace route after Prakith. An unusual world with an uncanny glow caused by its sun, it was considered extremely important by Emperor Palpatine.

Cantonica is a desert planet in the Cantonica system within the Corporate Sector of the galaxy's Outer Rim Territories. The planet is home to the casino city Canto Bight, which is a destination for wealthy tourists, gamblers, and war profiteers.
Celanon is an important spaceport on the Celanon Spur, in the Outer Rim Territories, and is the Nalroni homeworld.
Astronomical object in Outer Rim, little is known about it.
Centares is a planet in the Maldrood sector of the Mid Rim. It have a temperate climate and no moons.

Cerea is a planet located in the Mid Rim region of the galaxy. The homeworld of the Cerean species, Cerea is notable for its inhabitants' harmonious relationship with nature. Technology and pollution are frowned upon by the conservative government, a major point in the planet's decision not to join the Galactic Republic.
Chardaan is an Inner Rim world that lay at the intersection of the Hydian Way and Shipwrights' Trace. The planet is orbited by the Chardaan Shipyards.

Columex, once known as Nardolin, is a planet in the Outer Rim. Originally a minor Republic outpost, it was settled by Commenorian investors in the millennia before the Clone Wars, and became a prosperous trade world on the Perlemian Trade Route. Columex seceded from the Republic during the Clone Wars, but after its fall, the planet accepted Imperial rule.
Commenor is a planet in the Commenor system of the Colonies, just outside of the Core Worlds.

Concord Dawn is an agricultural frontier world in the Mandalore sector of the Outer Rim Territories. The planet has strong ties to the Mandalorians, its population share many Mandalorian values, and genetic markers specific to the natives of Concord Dawn are present throughout the Mandalorian populace.
Corellia is a planet located in the galaxy's Core Worlds known for its ace pilots and large starship manufacturers. Vessels such as the Millennium Falcon and Imperial starships are built on Corellia.
Corsin is a planet located in the Greater Plooriod sector of the Expansion Region.

Coruscant is an ecumenopolis in the Coruscant system of the Core Worlds. Coruscant was also known as 'Imperial City' under the Galactic Empire, and 'New Republic City' under the New Republic.

Famous for its cosmopolitan culture and towering skyscrapers, Coruscant's population consists of trillions of citizens hailing from a vast array of both humanoid and alien species.

Though debated by historians, it is generally believed that Coruscant was the original homeworld of humanity.
Crustai is the second planet of the Crustai system in the Unknown Regions.
Daalang is a world on the Gamor Run in the Mid Rim, near Attahox.

Dagobah is a remote, unexplored planet in the Dagobah system, and one of the purest places in the galaxy within the Force. A remote world of swamps and forests, it served as a refuge for Jedi Grand Master Yoda during his exile after the destruction of the Jedi Order.

Dantooine is a planet located in the Raioballo sector's Dantooine system of the Outer Rim Territories' northern New Territories region, near the Sinsang and Angor systems. It is the fourth planet in orbit of its sun Dina, and have two moons.
Darkknell is an astronomical object located in the Darkknell system of the galaxy's Outer Rim Territories, situated along the Hydian Way at grid coordinates M-17.

The Dathomir system in the Quelli sector contains planet Dathomir. Despite the presence of numerous predator species, a few thousand Human and Zabrak colonists call this place their home, even though the hostile environment hardened most of them.

Dellalt is an astronomical object located within the Tion Cluster of the regions known as the Outer Rim Territories and the Slice. The astronomical object is positioned within grid square T-6 on the Standard Galactic Grid.

Delrakkin is the only planet in the Delrakkin system capable of sustaining life. Home to the reptilian Delrakkin, the world is covered with mountain ranges and jungles, as well as a perpetual cloud cover that provide it with incessant storms and rain.
Denon, a planet located between Osarian and Nubia, is an ecumenopolis world, with city growth covering the entire surface, similar to Coruscant.
Dolla is an astronomical object located in the regions known as the Outer Rim Territories and the Western Reaches. It is situate in grid square L-18 of the Standard Galactic Grid.

Dorin is a planet located in the galaxy's Expansion Region that is the homeworld of the Kel Dor species. Its Dorin gas and helium-rich environment meant that they are forced to rely on rebreathers to survive off-world, as oxygen is deadly to them.
D'Qar is a verdant planet located in the Ileenium system of the Outer Rim Territories.
Dromund Kaas is the third planet in the Dromund system, a star system in the Sith Worlds region of the Outer Rim Territories's Esstran sector.

Eadu is a storm-stricken planet in the Outer Rim Territories. It hosted the Eadu Energy Conversion Laboratory prior to the outbreak of the Galactic Civil War, where Galen Erso and his team of scientists attempted to unlock the secrets of the kyber crystals as part of the Death Star project.

Eriadu is the primary world in the Seswenna sector, and one of the Outer Rim's most active trade centres. It sit on the intersection of several hyperspace routes, including the Rimma Trade Route, the Hydian Way, the Lipsec Run, and the Yankirk Route.

Empress Teta, once known as Koros and also called Cinnagar (after its capital city) is a city-world in the Deep Core. An ecumenopolis to rival Coruscant, Empress Teta is the hub of galactic civilisation in that region, and one of the few worlds that could be reached from outside the Deep Core. It is a major supplier of carbonite to the galaxy, which makes it a center of interest and power for the Mining Guild, which controls it in all but name. First colonised by slower-than-light generation ships in the millennia before the founding of the Galactic Republic, Empress Teta has had a tumultuous history, from the Krath Holy Crusade into the Clone Wars, where its control by the Mining Guild led to it joining the Confederacy of Independent Systems. During the age of the Galactic Empire, Empress Teta was a security checkpoint into the Deep Core.

Enarc is a planet in the Mid Rim. Located at the intersection of multiple hyperspace routes, it is a prosperous trade world and distribution center.
