Once a regional headquarters for the Trade Federation, it served as a staging point for the fleet of warships that blockaded Naboo, a decade before the Clone Wars. Following the rise of the Galactic Empire, Enarc was Imperialized, and transformed into an Imperial Army transport and supply depot.

Endor is a forested moon in the Outer Rim. Home to a variety of species, including the predatory Ewoks, it has been a relatively isolated section of the galaxy for thousands of years. However, it is also known for the many shipwrecks that have crashed there over the millennia. The Empire used Endor as the construction site for the second Death Star, and installed a shield generator on the surface to protect the battlestation. Four years after the destruction of the first Death Star, the Rebel Alliance engaged the Imperial Navy in the Battle of Endor, destroying the Death Star and killing the Emperor.

Esfandia is a small proto-planet in Wild Space. Once it orbited a star, but has since broken away and beome a rogue planet. Esfandia is one of the few worlds that housed a HoloNet Relay that could reach into the Unknown Regions.

Exodeen is a planet in the Colonies region, along the Hydian Way trade route. One of the earliest-occupied planets along the route, Exodeen was a loyal member of the Galactic Republic until the rise of the Empire. Its native Exodeenians could be found in both Imperial bureaucracy and within the Rebel Alliance.
Fedalle is a planet in the Core Worlds. An early member of the Galactic Republic, it maintained loyalty to the galactic government for much of its history.

Felucia is a world in the Outer Rim. It is a lush jungle world, populated with many strange plants, animals, and other organisms, and steeped in powerful Force energies. Colonised by the Gossam species thousands of years before the formation of the Galactic Republic (But still home to other native sapient species), it was controlled by the Commerce Guild for much of its history, and joined the Republic only decades before the outbreak of the Clone Wars. During the Clone Wars it joined the Confederacy of Independent Systems, and many fierce battles were fought for control over the system. In the age of the Empire, a garrison was maintained on the planet.
Firrerre is a world in the Outer Rim. Once home to the Firrerro people, it is now a barren world, all of its life having been eradicated by the Empire with a lethal virus.
Foless is a planet in the Colonies region, at the edge of the Inner Rim. It lies at the meeting point of the Corellian Trade Spine hyperroute and the Shipwright's Trace.

Fondor is a planet in the Colonies region. A heavily industrialised ecumenopolis, Fondor is one of the most prominent starship manufacturers in the galaxy, outclassed only by Corellia and Kuat. During the Clone Wars, it was ostensibly a member of the Confederacy of Independent Systems, but most of its population was unsupportive of the Separatist cause, and contributed little to the war effort. During the age of the Galactic Empire, Fondor's shipyards were used for classified research and development.

Fusai is a planet in the Outer Rim. It was home to a branch of the Celebratus Archive of Obroa-skai, but once Obroa-skai abandoned the branch, it was maintained locally. Fusai was a Rebel safe world during the age of the Empire, and a supercomputer in the library aided the Rebels in tactical and strategic planning.
The Garos system is a six-planet star system in the Mid Rim. It is located near the Nyarikan Nebula.
The Gerrenthum system is located in the Anoat sector in the Outer Rim of the galaxy. It includes the planet Gerrenthum.

Geonosis, is a ringed, rocky planet in the Arkanis sector of the Outer Rim Territories. The home planet of the insectoid Geonosians, it is known for its droid factories and violent gladiatorial games. The desert world was the Confederacy of Independent Systems' first capital, hosting its major droid foundries. It was the site of the Battle of Geonosis, the opening conflict of the Clone Wars, in 22 BBY.
Giju is a planet located in the galaxy's Colonies region along the Rimma Trade Route.
Gizer is a planet famed for the manufacturing of the Gizer L-6 freighter and gizer ale.

Glee Anselm is a peaceful water planet in the Mid Rim. The planet's surface is largely covered in water or swamps, with only a few clear landmasses dotting its surface. The planet have very frequent season changes, causing it to be ravaged by intense storms with some of them turning cyclonic. The climate is moderate most of the standard year round.
Gyndine is a planet in the Expansion Region. It is a local administrative center, and have mid-sized, advanced shipyards.
Hapes is the homeworld of the Hapans, a near-Human race known for their beauty, and the administrative capital of the Hapes Consortium.
Hosnian Prime is a planet in the Hosnian system of the Core Worlds, located along the Corellian Trade Spine.

Hoth is the sixth planet of the remote Hoth system. A desolate world covered with ice and snow, located in the Anoat sector, a rarely-travelled portion of the Outer Rim Territories, it became famous as the one-time location of the Alliance to Restore the Republic's Echo Base during the Galactic Civil War.
Huk is the home planet of the Yam'rii species, also known as the Huk (a Kaleesh slur translating as "soulless bug"). The planet is mostly covered with dense forests.

Hypori is a planet located in the Hypori system of the Ferra sector in the Outer Rim Territories. It is home to no sentient species, though it is host to windrails and massiffs. Its surface is covered in rocky landscapes and small oceans.

Ilum is an ice planet in the Unknown Regions, one of the main sources of the valuable Adegan crystals used in the construction of Jedi lightsabers. The caverns containing the crystals were long ago turned into a Jedi temple. Unlike the crystals of other planets, the crystals of Ilum are limited to blue, green and purple in colour. The planet is over ninety percent-covered by ice.

Imynusoph is an Outer Rim Territories astronomical object located in grid square J-21 of the Standard Galactic Grid. It is situated at the endpoint of the super-hyperroute known as the Hydian Way, which connect it to the celestial body Terminus.
Isde Naha is a world in the Outer Rim, located at the edge of the Greater Javin region. It is a highly industrialised world that strongly disapproves of smuggling.

Ithor is a planet in the Mid Rim. Home to the Ithorian people, it is a lush and vibrant world, teeming with life. This life was carefully guarded and tended to by the Ithorians, living in massive floating cities, and few people ever set foot on the surface.

Jabiim is a terrestrial world in the Outer Rim, located along the Triellus Trade Route. A planet of constant torrential rains, Jabiim's environment has been heavily polluted by decades of strip mining, and its heavily ionised atmosphere now produces dangerous electrical storms and acid rain. The world has been a constant target for warfare, bandit and pirate raids, and plagues. During the Clone Wars, Jabiim joined the Confederacy of Independent Systems due to feelings of being abandoned by the Republic, and many costly campaigns by the Grand Army were waged to bring it back under Republic control, shortly before the end of the war. During the age of the Empire, the planet was strip mined, leading to resistance movements striking Imperial holdings.

Jakku is a planet in the Western Reaches of the Inner Rim. Once a lush and forested world, a past calamity has rendered it a scorched, barren desert. Few sapients inhabit this largely ignored planet, save for those that do not wish to hide.

The Greater Javin is a backwater region of space in the Western Reaches of the Outer Rim. It is comprised of three subsectors: Javin, Anoat, and Yarith. It was explored five hundred years before the rise of the Galactic Empire by entrepreneur Ecclessus Figg, whose scouts expanded the Corellian Trade Spine into and beyond the Greater Javin region.

Jedha, also known as the Pilgrim Moon, or as the Cold Moon, is a small desert moon which orbited the planet NaJedha. The historical and spiritual significance of Jedha led the moon to become a world of worship for those who believed in the Force, and a holy site for pilgrims who sought spiritual guidance.\nJedha City was once located on the surface of this moon, but it was destroyed by the Empire.

Kabal is a planet in the Outer Rim. Before the Clone Wars, Confederate interference led to massive food shortages on the world, in a plot to encourage Kabal to secede from the Republic. The operation was successful, and the planet joined the Separatists. During the Galactic Civil War, Kabal maintained neutrality against both the Empire and the Rebel Alliance, even in spite of an Imperial assault on the Conference of Uncommitted Worlds being held there.

Kadavo is a planet in Wild Space. A barren world of dormant volcanoes and thick smog, Kadavo was part of the Zygerrian Slave Empire, and housed a slave processing facility. During the Clone Wars, a colony of Togruta was kidnapped by the Zygerrians and transported here, but a Republic force, led by General Anakin Skywalker, raided the facility and destroyed it, freeing the slaves.

Kalee is a planet located in Wild Space. Home to the warlike Kaleesh, it is a harsh, tropical world, covered in the Kaleeshi's temple-like homes. Since the planet's introduction to the galactic community, Kalee has sent its people to serve as warriors, bodyguards, and mercenaries for many conflicts and parties. Decades before the rise of the Galactic Empire, the Republic convinced the Kaleesh to wage war against an isolationist neighbour, then sided against them in their conflict with the insectoid Huks. A prominent Kaleesh general during the Huk War, Qymaen jai Sheelal, eventually became the dreaded Separatist cyborg Grievous.

Kamino is an aquatic world beyond the Outer Rim. Located between the primary galaxy and one of its satellite dwarf galaxies, the Rishi Maze, Kamino is home to the enigmatic Kaminoans, who had mastered genetic engineering and cloning technologies to save themselves from the ecological disaster that flooded their world. Known only to a few members of the Republic for thousands of years, Kamino suddenly became a critical asset leading up to and during the Clone Wars, in which the clone troopers of the Grand Army of the Republic were created on the planet. After the conflict, the Galactic Empire forcibly relocated the Kaminoans and their technology, and destroyed every facility on the planet.
Kashyyyk, also known as Wookiee Planet C, Edean, G5-623, and Wookiee World, is a Mid Rim planet. It is the lush, wroshyr tree-filled homeworld of the Wookiees.
Kelada is a planet in the Anarid Cluster. It was controlled by the Galactic Empire during the Galactic Civil War.

Kessel is a planet within the Akkadese Maelstrom that host spice mines. The planet also export coaxium and Kesselstone. While Kessel's northern hemisphere is devoted to mining, the planet's southern hemisphere is home to lush sanctuaries.

Kinyen is an agriworld in the Expansion Region, located on the Corellian Trade Spine at the junction to the Great Gran Run. It is the Gran species homeworld, with a recorded history dating back to 10,000 BBY.
The Kira system is located at the center of the Kira Run. It originally contained four planets, until three of them were destroyed by an unknown cause.

Korriban, known as Pesegam during the reign of Xim, and also known as Moraband by the time of the Clone Wars, is the sole planet in the Horuset system, located across the galaxy from Koros Major. It was the original homeworld of the Sith species and a sacred planet for the Sith Order, housing the tombs for many ancient and powerful Dark Lords of the Sith, and containing immense dark side power.
Kriselist is a planet in the Wornal sector of the Mid Rim.

Kuat is a planet located in the Core Worlds and one of the earliest members of the Galactic Republic. It is best known as the home of Kuat Drive Yards. These famous shipyards, used to build ships for both the Galactic Republic and later the Galactic Empire, circle the planet on thousands of kilometers.
Kubindi is a planet located in the galaxy's Outer Rim Territories that is the homeworld of the insectivorous Kubaz species.

Kuna is the common name for a constellation in the Outer Rim, the first planet of which is Kuna's Tooth. Remote, even in the Outer Rim, it is a cluster devoted to two things: mining, and smuggling. A particular smuggling ring deals in the trade of Rokna Blue, a drug made from a tree fungus from Endor.
Lah'mu is a ringed agrarian planet in the Raioballo sector of the Outer Rim Territories.
Lannik is a planet with a long history of war that is located in the galaxy's Mid Rim that is the homeworld of the Lannik species.

Lantillies is a planet in the Lantillies system and the sector capital of the Lantillian sector in the Mid Rim. Located along the Perlemian Trade Route and at the head of the Randon Run, Lantillies is heavily involved in the shipping and shipbuilding industries, and its Human natives are well-known for their emphasis on reliability over elegance.
Leritor is an astronomical object located in the galaxy's Mid Rim.
Lianna is an astronomical object located in the Tion Cluster of the galaxy's Outer Rim Territories that was home to the powerful Santhe family.
Llanic is a planet located in the Llanic system within the galaxy's Outer Rim Territories. It is situated at the intersection of the Llanic Spice Route and the Triellus Trade Route.
Loronar is an astronomical object located in the galaxy's Colonies region that is situated along the Corellian Run.
Lorta is a Mid Rim world located on the Cerean Reach, near Jiroch-Reslia. It is home to the violent and expansionist Lortans.

Lothal is a planet in the Outer Rim Territories. During the early years of the Galactic Empire, Lothal was in a state of economic disrepair and invited the Empire to take over the planet's industries, with the promise of prosperity and security.
Lucazec is a planet located within the Outer Rim Territories. Originally known as Far Thanium, it was absorbed into Xim's Empire as he expanded his borders from the Kingdom of Cron.

Molavar is a backwater, desert world in the Outer Rim Territories, with a number of seedy spaceports and low-income moisture farms. It is inhabited by beings of various species, but especially by the native Molavaran race.

Manaan is an aquatic planet in the Pyrshak system. It is home to the Selkath, an amphibious species. The planet is completely covered in water and is the only known source of the medicinal substance kolto in the galaxy.
The Manda system is a star system located in the galaxy's Mid Rim region and contain Manda and Manda Prime.

The Mandalore system, also known as the Mandalorian system, is a star system located in the Mandalore sector of the galaxy's Outer Rim Territories that contain the planet Mandalore, homeworld of the Mandalorian people, its moon of Concordia, and the planet Kalevala.

Mataou is a planet in the Outer Rim, along the Corellian Trade Spine. Once controlled by the Hutts, it had been abandoned by its former masters and become occupied by criminal groups and farmers of a native serpentine species. To the Empire, Mataou was little more than a checkpoint onto another hyperlane.

The Maw Cluster is a group of black holes located very close to each other.\nThe exact cause of several black holes being this close to each other was something of a mystery, as it seemed to be unnatural. Some speculated about the possibility of these black holes being placed like this by Ancient races from billions of years ago, but it has been revealed, that it has been created by the Killiks, as a prison for the 'metaphysical' entity Abeloth.\nThe close proximity of black holes make this environment dangerous, and unnavigable via hyperspace.

Milagro is a planet in the Expansion Region. Located at the intersection of the Correllian Run and the Harrin Trade Corridor, it is a prosperous trade and manufacturing world. It was first discovered in the early millennia of the Galactic Republic, and colonised by Corellians. In the age of the Galactic Empire it hosted an Imperial garrison.

Mimban is a swamp planet in the Expansion Region. Typically ignored by its neighbours, it was the site of decades of conflict between the native people and mining corporations. During the Clone Wars, the Galactic Republic aided the natives in repelling Separatist forces, but once the Galactic Empire was declared, the same soldiers that protected the planet instead began to subjugate it.

The Calamari system, also known as the Mon Calamari system and called the Daca system by the natives, is an eight-planet binary star system that is the home of the planet Mon Calamari. It is the capital system of the Calamari sector in the Outer Rim
Mon Gazza system is a star system located within the Lambda sector of the Mid Rim, and contain the planet Mon Gazza.
The Mustafar system in the Outer Rim Territories is centered around the star Priate, around which orbiting five planets, including Jestefad, Mustafar, and Lefrani.
The Muunilinst system is a 6-orbit system that contain the planet of Muunilinst.
The Mygeeto system is a star system located in the Albarrio sector of the Outer Rim Territories, and contain the crystalline planet Mygeeto. It is home to the native Lurmen species.

Being located in Wild space, at 'the end of the galaxy', this system is avoided by most people around the galaxy.\nFormerly hosting a Corporate Sector Authority penal facility, the system is now devoid of any meaningful activity, except for the occasional miners and pirates.

The Naboo system is a large star system located within the Chommell sector of the Mid Rim, which contain planets such as Naboo, Erep and Widow as well as their moons. It is centered around the star Naboo.

Nal Hutta, also known simply as Hutta, is a hot, swampy planet located in the galaxy's Outer Rim Territories that is the homeworld of the Hutt species. The planet is a haven for the criminal elements of the galaxy, located far from galactic authorities.
The Nanth'ri system is a star system located in the Kurost sector in the region of the galaxy known as the Mid Rim. The system contain the planet Nanth'ri.

Nar Shaddaa, nicknamed the "Smuggler's Moon," is the notorious moon of the planet Nal Hutta, homeworld of the Hutt species. It is home to a large criminal underworld dominated by bounty hunters and Hutt crime lords.

The Nazzri system is a star system located in the Lantillian sector of the Mid Rim that contain the planet Nazzri, which is inhabited by the Nazzar. It was the site of a major battle in the Great Sith War, and another in the Mandalorian Wars
Necropolis is a tombworld located on the Giju Run of the Core Worlds. Serving as a burial place for beings from all over the Core, it is also the home of boneworms and cryptberries.
The Neimoidia system is a star system located in the galaxy's Colonies. It contain the planet Neimoidia along with its moon. The Trellen Trade Route run through the Neimoidia system.
The Nimban system is located in Hutt Space. It contain the planet Nimban.
The N'zoth system is a star system in the Core Worlds that contain Y'ness, a moon on which kimber stones can be found.

Ord Mantell is a terrestrial planet located into the Bright Jewel system of the Bright Jewel sector in the Mid Rim Territories. It is located near Anobis and was originally settled by the Galactic Republic circa 12,000 BBY as an Ordnance/Regional Depot.

Orto Plutonia is a frigid planet located in the Pantora system of the Outer Rim Territories' Sujimis sector. It is orbited by the moon Pantora, which was long believed to be the only inhabited world in the system. It is home to a Talz colony, which was discovered during the Clone Wars following an investigation of a Separatist outpost. After a brief conflict between the Pantorans and the Talz, a peace agreement was reached.
The Ord Trasi system is a system in the Outer Rim. It contain the planet Ord Trasi.
The Pakuuni system is a star system located within the Pakuuni sector in the Outer Rim region of the galaxy which contained the planet of Pakuuni. It is near the Newland system.
The Palanhi system is a star system in the Fakir sector in the Bakchou arm. It contain the planet Palanhi.
The Prakith system is a five-planet system in the Deep Core region. It contain the planet of Prakith.

Parnassos is a desolate planet located in the galaxy's Unknown Regions. Formerly lush and green, Parnassos had been colonised by the Con Star Mining Corporation. Following a nuclear disaster, Con Star abandoned Parnassos and abandoned the colonists, who were forced to eke out a perilous existence on the environmentally ruined world.
Pax system is a system of the Expansion Region that include the planet of Plagen.
The Perma system is a star system located in the Core Worlds. It contain the planet Perma.
The Phindar system is a star system located within the Demetras sector in the Outer Rim region of the galaxy which contain the planet Phindar.

The Pho Ph'eah system is a star system located within the Kalamith sector in the Outer Rim Territories region of the galaxy. It contain the planet of Pho Ph'eah, homeworld of the Pho Ph'eahian species.

Polis Massa is an asteroid field located in the Subterrel sector of the galaxy's Outer Rim Territories, far from any major hyperspace lanes. At some point, Polis Massa was a planet located within the system of the same name. The planet was home to a subterranean people called the Eellayin until it was destroyed by ancient superweapons.
The Quellor system is a star system located within the Colonies. A battle of the Mandalorian Wars was fought here in 3962 BBY.
The Quermia system is a star system located in the Nilgaard sector of the Outer Rim Territories and contain the planet Quermia.
Rago is a planet located near the border of Wild Space and the Mid Rim that anchored the Rago Run to the Unknown Regions. It is the closest Galactic Alliance planet to the Colony of the Killiks.

Rakata Prime, also known as Lehon, was the homeworld of the long-extinct Rakata species, who were rumored to be the first to develop hyperspace travel, and is one of the few navigable worlds located in the Unknown Regions.

Randon is a planet from which the Randoni originated. It's a large business world with crowded bazaars and elegant corporate towers. It's at the intersection with several major trade routes, including the Trax Tube, Ootmian Pabol, Pabol Sleheyron, and the Randon Run.

Rendili is a planet in the Core Worlds and one of the Core Founders of the Galactic Republic. The planet is ruled by an Arch-Provost. It is the headquarters of Rendili StarDrive, founded in 20,000 BBY, and is affiliated with the starshipwrights Rendili Hyperworks,Rendili/Vanjervalis Drive Yards and Golan Arms joint venture.

Ringo's Moon is one of the four moons of the gas giant "Sergeant Pepper". The other moons are called Harrison's Moon, Paul's Moon and John's Moon. Nobody knows who named them, they were simply present in navigation database since forever.

Roche is an asteroid field in the Mid Rim. The insectoid Verpine call the field their home, but while they claim not to know where their homeworld is, some believe Roche to be the remains of the Verpine's original planet. Many Verpine colonies in the asteroids joined the Galactic Republic in its early years, and remained loyal through the Clone Wars. Roche is home to Slayn and Korpil, the manufacturer of the V-19 Torrent and B-wing starfighter.
Roqoo is a star in the Hapes Cluster, in the Inner Rim. The solar winds of this blue giant interact with the Transitory Mists surrounding the cluster to create magnificent auroras.

Rorak is an industrial world in Hutt Space. Having been under the control of the Hutts for more than ten thousand years, it is home to many smugglers and pirates, and the largest slave market in Hutt Space.

Rutan is a terrestrial world in the Outer Rim. It was home to the Rutanian people, who frequently warred with the Senali people of Rutan's moon. Eventually they made peace, exchanging firstborn royalty for a time to prevent each other from attacking.

Ryloth is a terrestrial world in the Outer Rim, near the end of the Corellian Run hyperspace route. Home to the Twi'lek species, it is a humid world with varied terrain. Originally discovered by Republic explorers ten thousand years before the rise of the Galactic Empire, Ryloth and the Twi'leks became influential in the galaxy due to the production of Ryll, a potent spice, and desire for female Twi'lek slaves. During the Clone Wars, the Confederacy invaded Ryloth, leading to a dedicated campaign by the Republic to liberate the planet. In the age of the Galactic Empire, the same guerilla resistance that worked with the Republic to free their home fought against Imperial occupation, often with the aid of the Rebel Alliance.

Saleucami is a world in the Outer Rim. A temperate, arid world with a variety of environments, it is a major trading center for the outer reaches of the galaxy. Due to its takeover by the Techno Union thirteen years before the Clone Wars, it had no choice in being recognised as part of the Confederacy of Independent Systems, and was the site of many battles between the Separatists and the Republic. Under the Galactic Empire, Saleucami served much the same role as an economic powerhouse.

Savareen is a world in the Outer Rim. Located at one end of the Kessel Run, it was home to a refinery for coaxium, a type of starship fuel. At one point, the criminal organisation Crimson Dawn operated a business on Savareen, and when the natives rebelled, their tongues were removed as punishment.

Scarif is a remote world in the Outer Rim. Once a tropical world used by the Galactic Empire as a secret research center, Scarif was struck by the Death Star and its environment ruined during a raid by Rebellion forces to acquire the plans for that battlestation.

Scipio is a frigid world in the Outer Rim. Homeworld to the Muun species, it has been an important center of commerce in the galaxy, being the headquarters of the InterGalactic Banking Clan. During the Clone Wars, Scipio was officially neutral, but leveraged its position to secretly (and not so secretly) aid the Confederacy of Independent Systems with cheap loans.
Sirpar is a large planet in the Outer Rim. Its high gravity made it suitable for use as a training center for the Galactic Empire.

When this system was under Imperial police authority during the Galactic Civil War, smugglers smuggling illicit goods through this system were literally on the run, in order to avoid being inspected, hence the name "Smuggler's Run".\nDue to the Empire's decline, the system is no longer under Imperial police authority.

Stenos is a terrestrial world in the Outer Rim. Originally named Maldont in the era before the forming of the Galactic Empire, it is home to the winged Stenax species, a spiritual and aggressive people.

Sullust is a volcanic world in the Outer Rim. Home to the Sullustan people, its underground cities form a major trade hub for the entire galaxy, and its native SoroSuub Corporation produces a wide range of goods, from comlinks to starships. During the Clone Wars, Sullust joined the Confederacy of Independent Systems. When the Galactic Empire was declared, the SoroSuub Corporation took control of the planet, which angered many locals that formed resistance organisations that allied with the Rebellion. Sullust was the site of the Rebellion's staging point for the attack on the Second Death Star above Endor.

Sump is a humid world in the Outer Rim. Home to the small-brained Nuknog, it is humid, impoverished, and heavily polluted. Nearly a thousand years before the rise of the Galactic Empire, the Nuknog sold the planet to a mining consortium, unwittingly enslaving themselves. After centuries of this slavery, a pair of Jedi brought news of the deal to the Senate, who required the conglomerate terminate operations and pay back centuries of unpaid wages. This broke the conglomerate, but the damage to Sump had already been done. Galactic interest in the planet faded after relief efforts were conducted, and it remained in unaligned space during the Clone Wars and during the age of the Galactic Empire.
Syvris is a small moon located in the Outer Rim. Located on the border of Hutt and Imperial space, it was a haven for smugglers, particularly smugglers of spice.

Taanab is a terrestrial world in the Inner Rim. Primarily an agricultural world, it produces the goods that feed much of the Inner Rim and Core Worlds. Originally discovered in the early days of the Galactic Republic, it was not colonised for more than twenty thousand years.
Takodana is a lush, forested world in the Mid Rim. Distant from galactic politics and bordering civilized worlds and the frontiers, it was seen as a haven for smugglers, explorers, and fugitives.

Taris is a terrestrial world in the Outer Rim. Located along the Hydian Way hyperspace route, it was a prosperous trade world that grew into a massive ecumenopolis, a city-world to rival Coruscant. During the Mandalorian Wars, almost four thousand years before the rise of the Galactic Empire, rogue Jedi used Taris as a staging point to combat the invading Mandalorian threat. However, less than a decade later, the world was bombarded by a fleet of Darth Revan's Sith Empire, reducing much of the planet to rubble. Efforts to recolonize the planet began centuries later, but never restored Taris to its former glory. During the Clone Wars it was a member of the Council of Neutral Systems, but was forced to house a Republic fleet to avoid a Separatist incursion.

Tatooine is a desert world located in the Outer Rim. Populated mostly by moisture farmers, scavengers, and the indigenous Jawas and Tusken Raiders, it has traditionally been located in Hutt space, and was home to Jabba the Hutt until his death shortly before the Battle of Endor. Once, this world was lush and vibrant, until some unknown disaster destroyed most life on Tatooine.

Telos IV, often called Telos, is a world located in the Outer Rim. Located on the Hydian Way hyperlane, it was a critical trade world for the Republic for thousands of years. Discovered shortly after the Great Hyperspace War, it grew prosperous, and served as a military installation during the Mandalorian Wars. However, in the Jedi Civil War, it was bombarded and ravaged by Darth Revan's Sith Empire, and its surface became uninhabitable. After the war, the Republic chose Telos to be the prototype of a project to restore war-ravaged worlds. Despite sabotage by the Czerka Corp, and an attack by the Sith Triumvirate, the project was eventually successful, seeding the world with life from all across the galaxy and restoring Telos to a prosperous beacon for the Republic. In the waning century of the Galactic Republic, famine ravaged the world, leading the governor, Crion, to covertly attempt to conquer a neighbouring world. His son Xanatos, a Jedi Knight, was sent to mediate between the two worlds, but he sided with governor Crion. Xanatos' padawan, Qui-gon Jinn, revealed the plot to the people of Telos, who rose against governor Crion. Following his death at Jinn's hands, Xanatos secretly manipulated the Telosian people into becoming more aggressive and warlike, and exploited the planet's natural resources into desolation. Xanatos committed suicide rather than be arrested. In the Clone Wars, Telos fell within Separatist-controlled space. During the reign of the Galactic Empire, the planet sided with the Rebellion, and was bombarded by Imperial forces, who then committed atrocities against the population.

Tepasi is a forested world in the Core Worlds. It was colonised by Humans prior to the founding of the Republic, was a founding member, and has remained a hub of commerce ever since. Tepasi is also home to the famous Tagge Company, one of the largest megacorporations in the galaxy.

Terminus is a bustling trade world in the Outer Rim, resting at the intersection of the Corellian Trade Spine and the Hydian Way trade routes. Due to its proximity to the Unknown Regions and Wild Space, it is not uncommon to see strange and unfamiliar ships in the local starports. An additional result of this unique location is the abundance of pirates and smugglers, who use Terminus as a shadowport.

Teth is a remote jungle world located in Wild Space. Once the home of a monastery of B'omarr monks, it was eventually seized by the Hutts and turned into a vacation and smuggling world. Eventually the Republic cracked down on the smugglers, and the world declined. During the Clone Wars, Separatist forces held the kidnapped son of Jabba the Hutt on this world, but Republic forces rescued the child. In the age of the Empire, Teth was home to a naval base and small shipyard.

The Redoubt is a remote star cluster in Chiss space, in the Unknown Regions. Discovered more than a century before the rise of the Galactic Empire, but only explored in earnest less than a decade before then. High radiation and the close proximity of the stars makes navigation difficult. The ill-fated Outbound Flight project ended on a planetoid in this cluster after being shot down by Chiss defence forces.

Thrago is a small moon in the Thrago system in the Unknown Regions. Little more than a ten-kilometer hunk of rock, its craters are so covered in dust that its craters appear almost featureless from orbit.

Thyferra is a hot, humid world in the Inner Rim. It is widely known as the primary source of bacta for the galaxy. Because of this, it has been contested in many conflicts since its discovery four thousand years before the rise of the Galactic Empire.

Tirahn is a bustling trade world in the Inner Rim, along the Perlemian Trade Route. With a varied population that was more than forty percent nonhuman, it is widely known for its massive bazaars and markets. During the Clone Wars it was conquered by the Confederacy in order to take control of critical supply lines that ran through the system, but a campaign by the Republic led to Tirahn being liberated decisively. The Empire maintained a light presence on Tirahnn, occasionally sending delegations to visit the sitting governor.

Toydaria is a large, muddy planet located in Hutt space. Once a vassal world to Nal Hutta, Toydaria deliberately maintains a low technological state, favoring traditional villages and the native Toydarians' own wings. During the Clone Wars the world tried to remain neutral, though its king allowed the Republic to use Toydaria as a base to deliver supplies to a besieged Ryloth, and later a military base. Eventually, this king was killed during a fight between Jedi and Separatist and Nightsister assassins.

Trandosha, also called Dosh or Hsskhor, is an arid world in the Mid Rim, in the same system as the Wookiee homeworld of Kashyyyk. Home to the reptilian and warlike Trandoshans, it joined the Republic around seven thousand years before the rise of the Empire, but it never integrated into galactic culture as deeply as other worlds. During the Jedi Civil War, Trandosha gained slaving rights to the Wookies of its sister world, sparking millennia of conflict between the two planets. In the Clone Wars, many "independent" organisations working with the Confederacy were funded by the government of Trandosha, as a way to wage war against Kashyyyk in secret.
Trellen is a planet located in the Core Worlds, located at the crossing of the Hydian Way and the Trellen Trade Route.

Triton is a small, nearly lifeless planet with three moons in the Outer Rim. Beyond its native insectoid Tritonite people, it is largely unremarkable beyond its location as a meeting point between two hyperlanes. During the Clone Wars, it was the site of a siege by the Republic against the Confederacy.

Tython is a forested, mountainous world located in the Deep Core of the galaxy. Forested and mountainous, it is often contended to be the original homeworld of the Jedi Order, formed tens of thousands of years ago. In ages past it has been visited by multiple spacefaring civilizations, but the ever-shifting hyperlanes of the Deep Core always lead to Tython being abandoned.

Umbara is a planet in the Expansion Region of the galaxy, cloaked in shadow. It is home to numerous predatory plants and animals, as well as the technologically advanced Umbaran species. Though a steadfast member of the Republic, even through the beginning of the Clone Wars, Umbara seceded and joined the Separatists after the assassination of their senator, and a major campaign was waged to return the planet to the Republic. During the age of the Empire, Umbarans served as Imperial spies, but have retreated to their home in fear of retaliation since the Battle of Endor.

Uviuy Exen is a terrestrial planet in the Colonies region of the galaxy, located at the intersection of two major hyperlanes. Throughout the history of the old Republic, Uviuy Exen had remained a loyal world, even through the Clone Wars. In the age of the Galactic Empire it served as a fortress world, and has seen many battles between the New Republic and Imperial Remnant forces.

This system is far from the galaxy's protected sectors, but very close to the pirate infested sectors. Thanks to this, and the dense milky fog covering the whole system, miners and traders disappear with alarming regularity here, though very few dare to get this far from the well-protected sectors.\nThe wreck field tells the story of numerous miners killed during pirate raids, after refusing to cooperate.\nBut there's something that even the pirates are afraid about. An unknown threat, which makes pirate raids less frequent in this sector, than in the past.
Not much is known about this system, apart from being located on a pirate-mapped hyperlane, which leads to the 'outermost' known system in the Unknown Regions, dubbed 'Unknown Region 3'.

Star systems and general expeditions in the Unknown Regions are considered uneconomical by most recognised governments. However, pirates and a few nameless privateers look forward to find an undiscovered race to be raided upon, or to make mutually beneficial trade partnerships with, respectively.\nThis system is considered to be one of the 'outermost' systems with pre-calculated Jump Routes leading to it. Formerly frequented by pirates and criminals, it was abandoned because of the extreme dangers of being far from any reinforcements in case of an attack by unspecified parties.

Utapau is a rocky world in the Outer Rim. Home to the Pau'an and Utai species, civilisation on this world is often built into the massive sinkholes that dot the landscape, revealing a subterranean ocean. Utapau was not a member of the Galactic Republic, and remained neutral during the Clone Wars until its occupation by the Confederacy of Independent Systems. In the final days of the war, Separatist leaders gathered there, but were nearly captured in a Republic assault. After the rise of the Galactic Empire, Utapau was occupied by Imperial forces.

Uyter is a terrestrial world in the Mid Rim. An agricultural world, Uyter received increased trade contracts for food when the Clone Wars began, as many other agricultural worlds had seceded with the Confederacy of Independent Systems. During the reign of the Galactic Empire, the world was home to an Imperial Academy.

Vakkar is a world located in the Colonies region of the galaxy. An early member of the Republic, it sided with the planet Alsakan during the Alsakan Conflicts, a series of wars waged between Coruscant and Alsakan across thousands of years over the right to be the capital of the galaxy. During the Imperial era, it was the sector capital of the Fakir sector.

Vergesso is an asteroid field located in the Outer Rim. During the age of the Galactic Empire it was home to an Imperial cargo depot, but also a secret Rebel shipyard and regional headquarters built into Vergesso Prime, the largest asteroid in the field. Some time before the death of the Emperor, this shipyard was destroyed by the Star Dreadnaught Executor.
Vondarc is a terrestrial world in the Mid Rim, along the Rimma Trade Route. During the Clone Wars, it was part of Separatist space. In the age of the Galactic Empire it housed an Imperial garrison.

Vortex is a terrestrial world in the Mid Rim, home to the seemingly emotionless Vor species. A member of the Galactic Republic for thousands of years, the center of culture on Vor was the famous Cathedral of Winds, a massive and intricate structure that created music using the planet's strong winds. When the Galactic Empire was established, the Vor declared that no music would be made on the planet, as protest against actions committed by the new government.

Voss is a terrestrial world in the Outer Rim. Originally having a single sentient species, the Gormak, the planet was discovered by the ancient Sith, who sought to exploit its natural resources. The Jedi who followed the Sith to Voss taught some of the Gormak tribes to use the Force, but this teaching led to a rapid evolutionary change in those tribes, creating a new species which called itself the Voss. After the Sith on the planet were exterminated and the Jedi left or died out, the planet Voss was forgotten by the galactic community for millennia, until its rediscovery after the Great Galactic War. Despite its neutrality during the Cold War, it served as a battleground between the Old Republic and the True Sith Empire. During the era of the Galactic Empire, Voss had become known as an unremarkable mining world, and the Empire unsuccessfully attempted to create more industry on the planet.

Wayland is a semi-tropical world in the Outer Rim. Once a Republic colony, a clerical error accidentally removed the world from all astrogation records and planetary logs, leaving it shrouded in mystery and legend. The human colonists, initially dominant with Republic technology, warred with the two native sentient species until they regressed technologically to the level of the indigenous peoples. Eventually, it was rediscovered by Palpatine, who used Wayland as a storehouse for arcane artifacts and secret technologies. Following the rise of the Empire, Wayland was home to a cloning facility, further developing the technology of the Kaminoan cloners.

Wrea is an oceanic world in the Outer Rim, located close to the Smuggler's Run asteroid field. Home to the aquatic Wreans, it is notoriously difficult to reach. During the Clone Wars it was home to a Republic outpost and comm tower, and during the Imperial Era it was used as a base by Saw Gerrera and his Partisans.

Wroona is an oceanic world in the Inner Rim, home to the Near-Human Wroonians. With a long tradition of seafaring and commerce, it is a major trade hub in the galactic community. During the Clone Wars, it was represented by the Pantoran Senator Chi Papanoida, despite being in Separatist territory. In the time of the Galactic Empire it was home to a small shipyard and Imperial garrison.

Yaga Minor is a world in the Outer Rim, known for its shipyards and native species, the insectoid Yagai. As a member of the Galactic Republic, Yaga Minor was the starting point of the famed Outbound Flight project, which sadly never completed its objective. During the Imperial Era, the Yagai were enslaved by the Empire and used as technicians throughout the Imperial Navy, and Yaga Minor itself became an important trade world and fortress.

Yag'Dhul is a small, rocky world, home to the mathematically-inclined Givin species. Its three moons produce such extreme tidal effects that much of the world's water and atmosphere are pulled to different parts of the planet, leaving the rest in vacuum. During the Clone Wars, the Givin came to the mathematical conclusion that remaining in the Republic would be more devastating than joining the Confederacy of Independent Systems, and provided ships and a staging point for Separatist forces. In the age of the Galactic Empire, some factions in Yag'Dhul's government supported the Rebel Alliance, and the world has been contested by various governments and warlords since.

Yavin 4 is the fourth moon of the gas giant Yavin, in the Outer Rim. A lush jungle world, Yavin was home to ancient Massassi warriors under the rule of the Sith Lord Naga Sadow thousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire. Through conflicts between Sith, and with the Jedi, Yavin 4 was once completely ravaged by war, but has since been terraformed back to its former glory, with life growing over the ruined Massassi temples. The largest of these, the Great Temple, was a military base for the Rebel Alliance, and from here the Rebellion struck out against the Galactic Empire at Jedha, and shortly afterwards destroyed the Death Star in orbit above the parent gas giant. The Empire and Rebellion have fought over the planet for years afterward.

Zeltros is a world of rampant hedonism and excess, dominated by constant partying and never-ending revelry. Though it joined the Galactic Republic four thousand years before the creation of the Galactic Empire, it never did join the Empire, and has never successfully been invaded, as the easy-going atmosphere (and the pheromones of the native Zeltron) quickly overwhelm most hostile parties.

Ziost is a temperate blue-green world in the far reaches of the Outer Rim. Formerly the capital of many Sith Empires, ranging from the empire of the late Pureblood Sith King Adas to the Sith Lord Adjunta Pall, to the True Sith Empire, and later the Brotherhood of Darkness, the planet has seen numerous climate changes and conflicts, including one conflict that rendered it entirely uninhabitable thousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire. Since that time it has slowly recovered, though it was largely forgotten after the New Sith Wars one thousand years before the founding of the Galactic Empire.

Zygerria is a rocky world in the Outer Rim known for being a center of slave trading. Once the center of a mighty slave empire, it had since faded from glory after that empire was destroyed by the Jedi. During the Clone Wars, the native Zygerrians resumed their slaving ways with the support of the Confederacy of Independent Systems, but their queen was executed by Count Dooku after she attempted to seduce Jedi Knight Anakin Skywalker.

Corulag is a populated terrestrial world in the Core Worlds. Originally a colony of Coruscant, it was an early member of the Galactic Republic and produced many advanced technologies and luxury goods. During the Imperial Era, it was home to the Corulag Imperial Military Academy, training many of the finest minds the Imperial military had to offer. Following the death of the Emperor it lost much of its influence.

The second planet of a weak red star in Wild Space, Nirauan is a jungle world inhabited by two sentient avian species, the Qom Jha and Qom Qae. It is also the headquarters of Grand Admiral Thrawn's Empire of the Hand, operating from an ancient tower called the Hand of Thrawn.

Corbos is a desert planet near the Yavin system. Though rich in ores, it is uninhabited, and typically avoided by colonists and miners, due to massive thunderstorms that render large sections of the surface inhospitable. Thousands of years ago, Corbos was the site of the final battle of the Hundred-Year Darkness, a major conflict between the Jedi Order and Dark Jedi separatists. Though the Dark Jedi lost the battle and were exiled from the Republic, they left bioengineered creatures known as Leviathans on the planet's surface, which destroyed the periodic mining colonies brave enough to set up on Corbos.

Thule is a dry, arid world that has long been connected to the Dark Side of the Force. Originally a part of the empire of Xim the Despot, Thule was colonised by ancient Sith who eventually drove many of its native life to extinction. For thousands of years, it has remained isolated and relatively unknown to the galaxy at large. From the Sith Empires of the Old Republic Era, to the Confederacy of Independent Systems, to the Galactic Empire and Emperor Palpatine, Thule has served as an isolated stronghold and resource world for Sith Lords. During the Clone Wars, the Techno Union deployed soldiers to Thule to reconstruct and reactivate an ancient Sith superweapon, the Dark Reaper. It was destroyed by Jedi Anakin Skywalker and Obi-Wan Kenobi before it could be used. During the Imperial Era, Emperor Palpatine erased knowledge of Thule of the planet from all databases, historical accounts, and navigational records.

The planet Ordo, in the Ordo system of the Mandalore sector, is the homeworld of the Mandalorian Clan Ordo, whose ancient member Canderous Ordo became Mandalore the Preserver after the Mandalorian Wars. It is mostly a desert planet, though its equator is ringed with some vegetation. Ordo is home to the Archaic Arsenal, a museum which housed a number of Mandalorian weaponry and armour.

Kalevala is the fourth planet in the Mandalore system, and neighbour to the Mandalorian's homeworld of Mandalore. A toxic desert world, Kalevala is the home of House Kryze, and the birthplace of the late Duchess Satine Kryze, former ruler of the Mandalorian Sector. The planet produces fine wines and rich textiles, and Kalevala Spaceworks manufactures custom luxury spacecraft such as the Nau'ur-class yachts First Light, owned by Dryden Vos, and the Coronet, used by Duchess Satine and her New Mandalorian Government.

Taris is a polluted urban planet located in the Outer Rim. Although Taris is a heavily populated ecumenopolis, much of the surface itself was polluted with wrecked starships and dense, overgrown swamps. Makeshift tenements made of shipping containers and crashed starships stacked on top of one another, while yellow smog drifted in the atmosphere. The elite of the planet dwelled in nicer skyscrapers.

Anteevy is an icy world in the Mid Rim. Once conquered by Mandalorian Neo-Crusaders, it eventually fell into Republic hands. Anteevy seceded during the Clone Wars, but was later annexed by the Galactic Empire, which created a factory to manufacture specially-modified AT-ATs that could withstand extreme cold.

Baros is a remote, arid world in the Outer Rim. Although it was first discovered many thousands of years before the rise of the Galactic Empire, it did not attract attention until that government received reports of coded messages being transmitted from its surface. Its reptilian natives, the Brubb, had begun sending those messages after theorizing that other sapient life existed in the galaxy.

Targonn is a world located in the outer edge of the galaxy. Home to the avian Targonnian species, this mountainous planet was ruled by a "Dictator-Forever" until it was liberated by an opposition group.
Out in the farthest fringes of the galaxy, beyond the Outer Rim, life is unpredictable and dangerous.
Many strange and dangerous things may be found out beyond the farthest reaches of known space. Few explorers venture this far out, and fewer still return.

The Renatasia system of the Outer Rim was one of many lost colonies founded from Core Worlders under the Old Republic. During the rule of the Galactic Empire, it was rediscovered by the Centrality sector, and following an undercover operation to unify the world's government the planet was subjugated by Imperial forces.

Rothana is a remote, icy world near the edge of the Outer Rim and Wild Space. Its most important feature is the headquarters of Rothana Heavy Engineering, a major supplier for military hardware to the Grand Army of the Republic during the Clone Wars. \n Discovered by scouts centuries before the fall of the Republic, Rothana's location was sold to Kuat Drive Yards, which spent significant effort to develop mines, factories, and shipyards on the planet. Far from Core Worlds politics, Kuat used Rothana to pursue secret projects, and did not even let its own ships know the location of the system.

Roon is a legendary world located deep in the Outer Rim Territories. Hidden within a cosmic dust cloud referred to as the Cloak of the Sith, easily-navigable hyperspace routes to Roon had long been lost, leading to high demand for native crystals called Roonstones.\n It is believed that the world was visited and settled by the ancient Taung species, after their exodus from Coruscant. Seven thousand years before the rise of the Empire, the Taung abandoned Roon and emigrated to the world that would come to be called Mandalore. Later inhabitants arrived to the world six thousand years later, close to the end of the New Sith Wars.
Gaulus is a terrestrial world in the Outer Rim. The Rebel Alliance once used this world as a base of operations, though they were eventually forced to retreat and escape from the Empire.

Lasan is a planet located in Wild Space that served as a secondary homeworld to the Lasat species, following the loss of contact with their original world, Lira San. When the Galactic Empire established its rule over the galaxy, Lasan resisted and challenged Imperial dominance, leading the Empire to invade the planet and attempt to exterminate the Lasat people.\n The commander of the siege, Alexandr Kallus of the Imperial Security Bureau, later defected and joined the Rebellion, fighting alongside one of the Lasat survivors, Garazeb Orrelios.
Conversation_Scientist_Hello5(talk to me again when found)
Conversation_Scientist_Reward3(you can have one of them as reward)

(war subs description)Due to our close proximity to %2 space, we are looking for volunteers help secure our borders as well as repel any %2 incursions. We have a wide variety of tasks to assign so whatever your skills do not hesitate to sign up!
(invite mission description)We are looking for volunteers to protect our space from the %2. If you believe you have the skills to help us secure our borders and protect our people, sign up!
What kind of jobs can I expect?
What can you tell me about them?
I'm here to help with the %1.

(email Content)Due to our close proximity to the %2 space, we are looking for volunteers help secure our borders as well as repel any the %2 incursions. We have a wide variety of tasks to assign so whatever your skills do not hesitate to sign up!
(email Appendix)You can find our contact information in your mission interface.
My job here is to help coordinate our efforts against our enemy.
If you're here, it means you have been recognised as a true friend.
There is a great need for pilots like you.
Our enemy has been a constant threat throughout our history. Many see them as a force of nature, something we have to weather and survive, but the reality is, this is a war.
We can't just throw every passing pilot at the enemy. Any potential recruits will undergo a probation period.
Each engagement needs to be a victory or they'll overrun us. I'm sure you knew that or you wouldn't be here. Let's get started.
Sorry, but this is a high-risk situation. We require pilots who have proven themselves.
There will be a wide range of tasks, from combat deployments to construction work. Depending on the situation, you will have a selection of tasks to choose from.
(unused)You will be paid as you complete your allotted tasks, with a potential bonus at the end.
(unused)As someone who's been toe to toe with the Xenon I'm sure you know what they are capable of.
(unused)The Xenon are a 'race' of intelligent, replicating machines and they have been a looming threat throughout our history.
(unused)They were originally created to help the Terrans explore the stars and terraform worlds but trying to control Artificial General Intelligence proved costly.
(unused)And now, hundreds of years later, we're still trying to clean up their mistake but we have no idea how far they have spread throughout the universe.
(unused)All we can do is hold out and prevent them from spreading any further. Every other government, allied or not, is faced with the Xenon threat. It's about the only thing we can all agree on.
(unused)We've even had temporary ceasefires with the Holy Order when faced with a Xenon attack. Quite temporary though.
Sorry. We're still reviewing your performance from the last time.
Alright. I'll have a suitable task picked out for you momentarily.
You will now find tasks related to our enemy in your mission interface.
The %2 activity has been increasing for some time now and we must be prepared for the case that we are their target.
While lacking, our intelligence network in the %2 space seems to suggest that an attack in imminent.
While we believe that the %2 are intelligent enough to learn from their actions, they continue to make the mistake of challenging us.
Our recon ships, at great risk to themselves, successfully provided vital information on the %2 activity. This gives us a major upper-hand in our operations.

The %2 seem to be becoming more bold, if they are even capable of such behaviour. After probing our defences in the previous skirmishes, they seem to think our space is an easy target. Unfortunately, they're not far wrong.
While Federation Intelligence continues to analyse recent %2 behaviour, we must make sure that our defences are prepared for the likely event of further %2 aggression.
There are a number of high-priority tasks which will be vital in securing our space.

The %2 have time and again proven to be a menace, but as we continue to learn about them, our ability to defend and fight back effectively improves. It is imperative that we hold out so that we can counter as soon as we are able.
We have a short window to shore up our defences and ready our people for the potential push from the %2. We're looking for independent contractors to help us with this.

The %2 do not seem to understand why they continue to fail when attempting to engage us in our own space. While that is not to say we have not suffered losses, we pride ourselves on our strong defences against the 'force of nature' that is the %2.
Our reconnaissance teams confirm a build up of %2 ships in their space and expect that they may soon make a move on us. While we have this respite, we will continue to prepare our defences.
We have learned much in the many years of conflict with the %2 and we must use that knowledge to continue pushing them back.
We are preparing a large-scale effort in shoring up our defences in cooperation with local corporations and neighbouring allies. Any skilled pilots are also encouraged to take part.
Given the apparent strength of the %2 forces amassing in their space, we current find ourselves at a disadvantage unless we can respond in kind and strengthen our own fleets and defences.
Our recent losses to the %2 have left us at a distinct disadvantage should they continue their push into our space. We must continue to push on with securing our space and protecting our people.

With our forces being stretched we will begin a drive to shoring up our defences with the construction of defensive structures and new ships. While this is taxing on our infrastructure, it is imperative that we don't give the %2 a free pass into our space.
We are looking for able individuals to aid our shipwrights as well as potentially invest significant time and resources into new construction projects.
While we only have a short window to shore up our defences, we expect any help in these areas will play a key part in future engagements with the %2.
The %2 do have the advantage of self-replication to help shore up their numbers, but we have shown time and time again that the %1 Navy can put up a fight, even against the odds.
Groups of %2 ships continue to mass around several entry points into our space. We don't know if they're aware that they are being monitored but it gives us a good look at their current strength.
Now is the time to make sure that our warships and static defences are ready to give the %2 a grand welcome once they decide to give us a visit.
We are looking for individuals able to provide significant time and resources in helping us complete a number of large construction projects.
Individuals with experience in station or ship construction are encouraged to help aid with the coordination of several defence projects.

If there's one thing we have in common with the %2, it's our reliance on the natural resources in our respective territories. Of course, they have the advantage that they don't need to maintain farms like we do.
One of the areas that the %2 seem drawn to are our resource fields where they often harass our mining ships. We also assume they're scouting for resources which they can use for their replication.
If we are to continue our struggle against them, as well as simply survive, we must be sure that our factories and shipyards continue to get the resources they need.

Our supply lines have previously been disrupted by %2 activity to the point that it became a substantial risk to our fighting ability. To safeguard against this, we are to focus on preparing our infrastructure for any potential economic shock the %2 may cause.

The recent %2 activity, as well as our war with the Holy Order has put a sizeable strain on our infrastructure and supply lines, leaving us with slow construction projects and the onset of rationing. As we can not allow this to continue we are requesting the willing and able pilots to help us reverse the situation.

We expect the conflict with the %2 will once again have some skirmishes occur in our territory. While we have enough measures in place to mitigate their activity, we must ere on the side of caution, especially when it comes to our supply lines.

It seems that the %2 are preparing for some raids into our space. We are confident in our defences but it is foolish to underestimate the amount of damage the %2 can cause when they run amok, especially to freighters and mining ships.

As we continue to press the %2, we must guarantee that our economy continues to function smoothly. This will include protecting our supply lines and mining areas as well as searching for any new sources of raw resources.

We have a number of tasks to both relieve economic stress on our infrastructure as well as safeguard supply lines and resource gathering areas. If you have the facilities to help, please consider signing up for assignment.
While we expect that the ever-restless %2 are preparing another offensive against us, our intelligence agencies currently lack the resources to help us prepare our defences effectively.

In recent weeks we have been working with nought but rumour as we try to get on top of the %2's activities and intentions. While we know a new offensive is coming, details such as ship numbers and location remain lacking.

Our best people have been hard at work to come up with ways to help us improve the our intel and give us a helping hand in tracking the %2. Any solid information will give us a much higher chance to counter further aggression.

Over the many years of attempting to better understand the %2, we have taken many risks such as going deep into their space or salvaging their wreckage. Any interaction with %2, even those rendered inert, is thwart with danger.

We have a number of tasks available, some of which may involve spending time in %2 territory or even interacting with the %2 themselves. As such, these tasks are designated heavy risk. We require pilots confident enough to go behind enemy lines and skilled enough to come back safely.

A number of intel tasks are available. That said, given the dangers that operations in %2 space pose, we are only looking for pilots who are confident in their ability to work behind enemy lines as well as get back in one piece.
Despite having favourable outcomes in our recent engagements with the %2, we can't overlook that our intelligence agencies are often working with outdated information.
If we want to continue holding the %2 back the way we have been we must ensure that our intelligence is both up to date and reliable.
We have several options available to us to improve our intel to allow us to formulate better strategies against the %2.
We are looking for trusted and skilled individuals to perform a number of these tasks, helping us maintain the upper hand.
The %2 have been pressing us quite hard recently, but it seems that we have an opening to deal them a blow. Any distraction which pulls them away from our space will give us a much welcome reprieve.

With the %2 being a constant sight for such a long period of time, it has felt that we were on the back foot. However, our intelligence teams have found several targets worth engaging in the hope that it will have the %2 pull back somewhat.
We will take any opportunity to repair our defences and redeploy our forces.

We would be fools to think we can predict what the %2 will do, but we know that if we hit them hard enough, they will have no choice but to send at least a large chunk of their forces back home. We're looking for level-headed and skilled pilots, capable of doing the job and getting home safely.

They may have forced our hand but the %2 are just as vulnerable to hit-and-run tactics as anyone else. As long as those involved come back safe, we believe this is worth the effort. Even if it doesn't have the desired effect, it will at least give the %2 something to waste CPU cycles on.

We've managed to score some major victories against the %2 as of late, but it certainly isn't a time to let up. While we expect a counter attack from them any time, we believe we can buy more time to organise our defences by striking sensitive targets.

We have known for some time that the %2 might come for us again, as they have many times already. Our tactical teams are forever working to devise new ways to have the %2 go in circles and this may just get their attention.
Any additional time we can get will be spent on better preparing for the next push against them as well as strengthening our current positions.
We're looking for a select number of skilled and experienced pilots who are confident in their ability to get behind enemy lines, cause some havoc and come back safely.

Things are looking rather dire. One thing these machines have over us is the fact that they feel neither fear nor exhaustion. They are just launching one attack after the other, without respite. We need time to pull ourselves together, and the best way to do that is to disrupt their operations enough to divert their focus.

Our supplies are steadily diminishing. We need to turn this war around and finally gain some ground on %2 Empire. Not many things will actually hurt them, but if we managed to destroy one of their stations, we might be able to turn the tide.
We can only withstand their relentless invasion for so long. That is why we are looking for someone to aid us with this crucial operation.
They might have us on the ropes at the moment, but blowing up one of their stations will give us some air to breathe. Make no mistake, though, this will be a hard battle.
If we manage to cut a swathe through their front line, we can gain a foothold in their sector and turn this war around. To pull this off, we need to weaken their control by targeting their stations.

When you fight these rigid machines, it is important to make an effort to act unpredictably, even erratic, sometimes. It will take them considerable time to formulate an adequate response. This is why command has decided to strike the enemy where they least expect it.
We have made considerable progress on the %2 front. Enough that we can push into their territory, and deliver a devastating blow. These circuit boards won't know what hit them!
If we manage to destroy one of their stations we could disrupt production, and possibly even severely weaken The %2 control over the sector. It is a vitally important task.
Because of this operation's importance, we decided to turn to a powerful ally such as yourself, and are willing to pay handsomely. If you can pull this off, that is.

page.title: war subs text backup
page.t: Throughout this conflict, the %2 have again proven to be a formidable force, making advances on several fronts. Along with our allies, we have held them back in several vital areas but we have lost ground.
We have commenced operations to reclaim our territories but we expect this will be a long and drawn out effort.

We are calling on all willing and able pilots to help us drive the %2 out of our space. Tasks will involve backing up combat units as well as defending critical areas as we continue to regain a foothold.
Thanks to the efforts of the Rebel Alliance Navy, our allies and volunteers such as yourself, we are currently in a prime position to deal a heavy blow to the %2.

Their constant aggression has thinned out their forces and they find themselves on the back foot. While we can't expect to put an end to the %2 once and for all, we can at least push them back far enough to secure our space.

We are looking for driven and skilled pilots willing to brave The %2 space and help with our efforts. Jobs will include linking with combat wings to both attack their positions as well as defend ours.

While there are others working on building larger military installations to help in our defence, many crucial areas still lack basic defences such as laser towers. This is something we want to resolve as quickly as possible.

The %2 are a threat to all other races, and as such, we must cooperate where we can. There is a neighbouring sector with an entry point for the %2 where we feel it imperative that defences improve. We require a number of mines to be placed in this strategic location.

As you may well know, we share a border with the %2, although it's unclear if they even conceive borders. Either way, it is an incredibly important strategic location. We feel that sector security will be improved should we deploy a number of mines in that area.

We expect one of the reasons for the %2 to intrude in our territory is to take advantage of our resource rich regions. To help secure these areas, we would like you to deploy a number of laser towers at strategic points which are critical to our economy.

At the request of our intelligence division, we require a single satellite to be placed in a vital area. We not only want to gain sensor data for that region, we also want to bait the %2 into some response. Anything we can do to dictate their movements or reveal their strength will aid us when we have to make a move ourselves.

Though our main priority in this area is to keep an eye on the movements of the %2, a sensor grid is necessary to track any potential threats to our space. We are looking for you to acquire satellites and fill the holes in that net.\n$REQUIREMENTS$
While they may not last long, we would like the opportunity to deploy satellites and build a better picture of The %2 space and their ship movements.\n$REQUIREMENTS$

Several of our ships are in need of minor repairs and to help take the strain off of our shipyards, we are looking to make as many in-space repairs as possible. As the crew continues to repair the internal systems, we require additional help for the hull and external sub-systems.

A number of specialists on The %2 behaviour and historical impact are to be transported to strategic locations to aid those preparing our defences. We require a number of pilots to come forward to provide safe and swift transport for these clients.

We are requesting a new military installation to be built in a strategic location to help us defend against any future aggression from the %2. We will require the facility to fit the following specifications.

In order to plan future operations against the %2, we would like to gauge what resources they have available to them in their space. Attempt to find high yield regions of the following resource: $WARENAMES$

A number of scientists from several races have banded together to launch an independent expedition into The %2 space. Not only is this a completely reckless endeavour, it hands the %2 a high-spec science ship full of valuable data right onto their lap. We need this ship stopped, preferably without bloodshed. A boarding operation is authorised.
As we push to take control of $SECTOR$, we require support for our combat units in whatever way possible.

One thing we believe gives us an edge on the %2 is that no two people are the same. Given enough discipline, any two pilots can work together and become a capable team, even in the heat of battle. This gives us a very fluid presence on the battlefield which we don't think the %2 can handle that well.
We are looking for $NPCCOUNT$ pilot\(s\) to undergo provisional tests for our rapid-response program.
$DESTINATION$
$SKILLS$

To make sure that our military installations are performing at peak efficiency during the war against the %2, we are looking for $NPCCOUNT$ engineer\(s\) to be brought to one of our stations.\n$DESTINATION$\n$SKILLS$

You cannot win a war without a fleet. Our shipyards are working at full capacity, but in order to bolster our numbers, we require the support of independent suppliers. To help in the war-effort, please bring the following ships to $SECTOR$ :\n$FLEET$

There have been concerns from several station managers that the increased The %2 activity will have a heavy impact on their supply lines. As the state of the local economy has a direct impact on our ability to construct defences we have agreed to assign a number of agents to help them stockpile resources.\n\nThe station related to this task requests that their resource levels are raised above: $STORAGEPERCENT$%

A number of The %2 ships of a certain spec have been causing us a lot of trouble recently. While any The %2 taken out is a good thing, we are keen to take these specific ships out of the picture as soon as possible. You will need to keep an eye out for The %2 with the following specification: $SHIP$

In the past, we have managed to perform detailed scans on a number of The %2. To progress in our research, we require a follow up scan on a specific The %2 to better understand their development over time.\n\nTarget reveal percentage: $PERCENT$

One of our best chances to deal a significant blow to the %2 is by disrupting their infrastructure. We're not too sure how much of it is involved in their ability to self-replicate, but they wouldn't have stations if they weren't important. We need one of these such stations scanned.\n\nTarget reveal percentage: $PERCENT$
We are interested in getting more detailed information on The %2 station modules to help us when planning future operation in The %2 space.\n\nWe need the following module scanned: $MODULE$

There have been reports of The %2 collecting salvage after battles, which is not unheard of. Some reports however mention them being interested in some items we would not have expected. To give these sightings more merit, we would like to catch a The %2 craft carrying some of these items. Once confirmed, we'll put additional effort into theorising what the %2 could be using these items for.\n\n Find a The %2 ship containing: $WARE$
We have lost track of a The %2 ship of interest and need someone to help track it down. The ship in question has ID code $IDCODE$

Federation Intelligence assigned our task force to map out crucial targets in the %2 energy networks. Such groundwork could enable the Rebel Alliance to cripple multiple The %2 facilities as a whole. To complete our survey we request additional scans of The %2 ships transporting Energy Cells.

Even the %2 rely on basic resources to build their infrastructure. In an attempt to understand, predict and ultimately control their territorial behaviour through deterrents, our The %2 specialists from Sandwell request scans of The %2 ships transporting Ore.

While industrial espionage allows us to quickly catch up on any technological progress in the Gate network, the undeciphered The %2 communication protocols prevent us from gathering this kind of intelligence. However, being close to The %2 space grants us the unique opportunity to learn about their advances in economic organisation. To achieve this, our The %2 specialists request scans of The %2 ships transporting Silicon.

(Mines)We are preparing a foray into The %2 space in a big way, but our scouts have spotted a cluster of mines. At best, these explosives could slow down our advance, and at worst they could be a real danger to our fleet. If you cleared the way, you might save a lot of lives.

(Mines)On our last hit and run operation targeting a station in The %2 space, one of our squads maneuvered themselves into a minefield. We lost contact almost immediately, so it is safe to say that unfortunately, they won't be returning. Help us destroy The %2 mines to make sure something like this does not happen again.

Our analysts have identified a station that is crucial to the %2. We need to act decisively and with full force to take it apart. This mission is of extreme importance, and you should expect to be met with considerable resistance.

Command is awaiting a big shipment of weapons parts and other various resources that are crucial for mounting an effective offensive. We are playing for time right now. If it weren't for that delayed shipment, we'd be launching an attack already, but that's the situation we have to deal with. Nothing we can do. We want you to prepare that offensive by going after our future target's defensive systems and disabling certain turrets of key importance.
